20399765.review:
This is a very decent collection of hidden object puzzles that is encased in a shell of inadequate point and click adventure game conventions, and edutainment minigames. 

First- The meat of the game, which are the hidden object puzzles, is quite scrumptious. It's as good as the best 2-d drawings, but with the addition of some animation tricks which only the video-game medium could provide. 

However

Second- The rest of the game is lacking. The story is poorly written and poorly performed (from a voice acting and animation perspective), and the remaining gmaeplay is usually tedious. 

A) The "narrative" experience this game has to offer is not captivating because of the lack of quality voice acting, the extremely low number of animation frames, and just inadequate writing and scripting. The only postive is that the setting is firmly in the "Age Of Sail" fantasy pirate genre. 

B) The "point and click" adventure game aspects are usually illogical (as is typical for that genre). The puzzles are not solved by rational thinking, but rather by thinking within the perspective of the game developers.  

C) The other minigames within the game are educationally entertaining at best, boring at worst. You have tile matching puzzles, tile swap puzzles, simple instruction following, and shape identification. 

D) The game also offers Mahjong solitaire as an alternative to the hidden object game sections. The art assets for this are certainly less artistically drawn.

This is still a very good game if you want to play about 20 hidden object puzzle pages.

20201349.review:
Dr. Black is the single worst museum curator in the history of terrible museum curators (you don't store priceless works of art in unprotected storage! Nor do you ship improbably mummified corpses in non-climate controlled packing crates!), but that doesn't stop this from being an utterly charming game, especially after you make it out of the museum. None of the puzzles are too tricky, and it's usually pretty obvious what you have to do or where you have to go next. Also, you can play mahjong instead of looking for things, which is an excellent change of pace.
The storyline requires a little suspension of disbelief (see: corpses mummifying underwater, among other things), and gets a little... uncomfortable about two thirds of the way through, but ultimately is charming, and the art is a delight to look at and interact with.

19366254.review: 第一次入这种游戏，本来还担心有所不值，但是体验之后感觉还说得过去（不建议单独买，还是慈善包比较划算）。虽然一直没玩但是这个公司的大名我还是常常听到的，在手机上也尝试过类似的游戏试玩版。对于玩腻了3A大作（并非嘲讽）对各种游戏食之无味的人来说简直是福音。剧情做的很用心，但是不少人说这一作在CG和过场上偷工减料我也看到了。AV画质简直不能忍，不过还好是剧情解密向游戏，并不算大碍。下午刚刚入玩了大半天，打发时间利器。不过不能长时间玩，不然容易乏味。等过几天再试试另外两部。总体而言要是有慈善包还是很值得入得。原价单入就有点不值了。

19362910.review:
It was my first experience with Artifex Mundi's games and I was so hooked that I'm buying any game from them once on Steam.

Nightmares from the Deep puts you in the shoes of Sarah Black, a museum curator in the Caraïbean Islands, and interested in the pirates stories. After receiving the corpse of the famous Henry Remington, don't ask how but you awakened him. Taking your daughter as hostage, you sneak into his ghost ship and find yourself in a race against the clock to save your child.

The story is beautiful as you're also diving into the pirate's past and love story. Besides, Remington is cursed because of a pact with Davy Jones, only you can undo it. And Davy Jones is important for the trilogy anyway. 

The gameplay mixes point-&-click, puzzles and hidden objects scenes. It's well balanced: all the puzzles aren't too hard but are not too easy (though one or two of them could be seen as harder to understand). I didn't find anything wrong or buggy.

The graphics are correct but beautiful too as between the boat and the island, you have also that surnatural aura surronding you. As for the soundtrack, nothing bad can be said.

Also, you have a bonus chapter, showing how you rescued another poor soul on your way home. 

A well-constructed plot, a nice ambiance, a balance for the difficulty, you have everything in this hidden object game. Never hesitate for this one!

19273128.review:
While this game is not outstanding in the point and click genre, it's certainly not bad either. To sum it up, this is way I liked or disliked about the game.

Pros:
- Great art style, fits the gloomy setting of the game
- Well made soundtrack, setting an adequate mood.
- While the synch is not exactly perfect, the voice acting is good.

Cons:
- Hidden Object scenes are entirely random. You search for 20 objects, one of which you are actually looking for, the rest dissapears forever.
- Item Usage often doesn't make sense. At one point you need a stone to smash a window even though you have an iron wrench in your inventory.
- The quality of cutscenes is horrible. This may just be an issue I had, so I don't know if it's the same for everyone.
- Most items that you use are immediatly discarded forever even though you would need them later. Instead you have to search for a similar item all over again. 

To put it in a nutshell, I miss the logic aproach that most point and click games should use. If you need a certain item for a situation, you should usually be able to figure out which one on your own. Also, If I have to find a total of 3 scalpels to use in 3 different situations, I'm beginning to question if my character instantly annihalites every item that has served it's purpose once as a personal one-use policy. However, the game can still hold it's own with it's art style and soundtrack, which is easily good enough to create the atmosphere required for the game.

19229803.review:
[h1][b]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart[/b][/h1]
[h1][b]深海噩梦:被诅咒的心[/b][/h1]

[b][评分:6/10][/b]
[quote]
解谜党必备.
[/quote]

19224223.review:
...and here we have another Artifex Mundi caliber HOG. I've been meaning to play this game for ages now. Finally being able to find the time, I'm rushing here to give you my full review. [i]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart[/i] is one of Artifex Mundi's earlier games, thus it is quite possible to encounter amateur mistakes or some clumsy animations now and then. Yet, the charm attached to the developer’s name doesn't fail to entertain us anyway.

Here we have Sarah Black, the curator of the Caribbean Museum and the mother of one cheery teenage girl, preparing the exhibition of a life time. The mummified corpse of Henry Remington, most notorious pirate of the Caribbean Sea back in 1800s is finally discovered and retrieved from his resting place: "Davy Jones' Locker" a.k.a the bottom of the sea. The corpse is delivered to the museum for the exhibition, and Sarah prepares him to be displayed. Just as we were thinking that he seems kinda handsome for a corpse that's been lying at the bottom of the sea for some centuries, he comes back to life, kidnaps our daughter, summons his ghost ship and sets sail to Skull Island... Oh, where did I see that before?

Okay, okay, I'll say it. I have no idea about the rest of the series yet, but this first game is basically a retelling of [i]Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest[/i] without Captain Jack Sparrow to lighten up the mood. But as the first instalment of the [i]Nightmares from the Deep[/i] series - and possibly the most clumsily done - [i]The Cursed Heart[/i] still finds means to keep you interested, with a detailed story of its own, weaved out of countless nautical folktales. Hey, I'm glad that we have a name for the protagonist at least, contrary to "Madame Detective" of [i]Left in the Dark[/i].

Artwork is most brilliant with its eerie depictions, nautical themes and an expected amount of undead roaming around. At this point, no one expects Artifex Mundi to present bad artwork, even with its older titles. What I do wonder though, is that how they've managed to make cinematics in lower quality than actual game artwork. Cinematics are blurry and less presentable compared to actual in-game artworks. Same goes for the voice acting: voice acting itself is beyond par, but the lip synch is non-existent: people do move their mouths rhythmically, that's all. I think this is forgivable considering that this is an older title though.

Here comes the gameplay: we have quite enjoyable and clear HOG scenes, some FROG scenes, a good amount of enjoyable puzzles and alternative Mahjong games if you are bored of object hunting. It takes at least 2 playthroughs to complete all achievements - one for HOGs, one for Mahjong games. The map is not interactive, but you get used to the environment quickly, and there is little backtracking aside going back to the ship to place a Dubloon on a chest and listen to an undead dwarf tell a story now and then. What's that about? You gotta play the game to learn!

[i]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart[/i] is probably not Artifex Mundi's best game, but it is a promising title and the start of a possibly enjoyable journey on a series. If you'd manage to grab it on sale, you'd enjoy it thoroughly when you'd be in the mood for a pleasant little HOG.

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

这次的游戏发生在加勒比海上的骷髅岛，浓浓的一股海盗风，玩游戏时我一直是在脑补《加勒比海盗》主题曲的……

剧情上有些地方经不起推敲，不过反正已经是魔幻题材了，再提科不科学的似乎也没啥意义了……	[strike]在虚拟世界中寻找现实的人脑子都有病233[/strike]

比起该公司其他游戏，本作是我第一次玩到的游戏中自带攻略的地方，这里简直是一大进步啊。如果在谜题卡住了可以直接番攻略，就不用去网上找了。找东西的地方比较多，不过大多难度都比较低，瞎点基本也能找到大半。如果找不到还可以使用麻将游戏配对，增加了游戏的多样性。

缺点的话，就是过场动画像素太低，直接变成了马赛克，不知道是不是一支平台造成的。不过静态的画面还是挺漂亮的。不过毕竟是这个游戏的第一作，或许在后面的作品里会有提高吧。

如果游戏打折，非常建议入手。

19058837.review:
I must say, I haven't completed a lot of HOG games. Three, if I recall. So, due to that fact, I can't really rely on past experience in order to review a game of this genre. But still, I can identify one that is of higher quality, and that title is Nightmares of the Deep: The Cursed Heart. I've also come to know that Artifex Mundi's games (most of them) are actually pretty good, overall. And that's exactly what I can say for the first entry in Nightmares of the Deep (NotD). It is a pretty good HOG.

Originality reigns in this title. And I love it. You'll find numerous puzzles, and all of them are different in such a way that it amuses me. Just like in all HOG's, you complete these puzzles in order to receive an item, unlock an object, etc etc. Completing this certain task will lead you to another, and another, and another, until you reach a critical point in the game and achieve some objective you were trying to accomplish. Same with HOG scenes. There is, however, a twist in this part of NotD. You can skip the entire section that consists in finding, or assembling hidden objects, and replace it with a mahjong game. I've found this feature entertaining and distinguishes this HOG from others out there.

Graphics wise, the scenarios are pleasant to look at. A negative aspect might be considered as the cutscenes, which are of lower resolution. Same with character animations, and the horrible lip sync, that are clunky and not really believable, which is obviously not the point of an HOG, to look realistic, but I'm sure they could have done a better job in this department.

Looking at the story, it's actually a strong point in NotD. I won't spoil it, of course, but I can say it's pretty interesting. I also enjoyed the fact that some storytelling is told through ghosts scattered around the different scenes. And I must indeed admit, pirates plus HOG equals and awesome combination. The soundtrack is catchy and it looks like we're searching for Jack Sparrow or something related. Achievements add replayability and a "bonus chapter" that could have been totally implemented into the main game is always compelling, I guess.

[h1]Overall, I recommend this HOG title, 100%, for the average, hardcore, or beginner HOG gamer, and for the ones who just want to take the genre for a spin.[/h1]

18729370.review:
Тот самый случай, когда хотелось бы поставить игре нейтральную оценку, но нет такой возможности. По стандартам "я ищу" Кошмары из глубин очень неплохи - ролики-вставки, какое-то подобие сюжета, озвучка, неплохие мини-игры, возможность пропустить сцены поиска предметов и заменить их маджонгом, красивые арты локаций и персонажей опять же. Но от Artifex Mundi, которые известны не просто хорошими, а отличными играми в жанре, ожидаешь большего - умеют же, показывали не раз!
Но даже если опустить тот факт, что Кошмары из глубин просто проигрывают другим работам компании по качеству и интересности, есть и другие недостатки. Ужасного качества видео-ролики, обилие сцен с поиском какой-нибудь маленькой вещи на аляповатом фоне, постоянная беготня между локациями. Для меня, однако, самым большим недостатком был сюжет этой истории. Ё-моё, сколько можно уже рассказывать сказки о стокгольмском синдроме и выдавать это за любовь? Он кровожадный и жестокий пират, она молодая аристократка, и, конечно, она влюбляется в того, кто взял её в плен - как же иначе-то. А уж финал...
Честно говоря, это была первая игра Artifex Mundi, которую я еле-еле дошла до конца и даже не стала проходить бонусную историю. Поэтому не рекомендую - за ту же цену у этой же компании вы найдёте гораздо более интересные игры без вышеописанных недостатков.

18237215.review: "Nightmares from the Deep - Das verfluchte Herz" bringt alles mit,was ein Wimmelbildspiel haben sollte. Man nehme optisch eine sehr gelungene Piraten und Spuckgeschichte,würfelt diese zusammen und daraus entsteht eine Schaurig-schöne und teuflisch gute Geschichte. Man merkt den Entwicklern an,dass sie mit viel liebe zum Detail die Szenenbilder ausgearbeitet haben und diese dadurch grafisch zu überzeugen wissen. Die vorhandenen Videosequenzen und Animationen sehen für ein Wimmelbildspiel ebenfalls hochwertig aus. Es gibt auch einfache/ knackige Rätsel,die es zu lösen gibt und Zeit beanspruchen werden. Für alle die sich die Zähne an den Rätsel ausbeißen,gibt es natürlich auch eine Hilfsoption,wo das Rätsel auf der Stelle gelöst wird,dies musste ich aber persönlich nicht in Anspruch nehmen. Desweiteren enthält die Collector's Edition noch zusätzlich ein großes Paket an Extras wie z.B. ein Bonuskapitel, Entwürfe, Videos und vieles mehr das sich freischalten lässt. Im Groß und Ganzen ist "Nightmares from the Deep - Das verfluchte Herz" ein wirklich tolles Wimmelbildspiel geworden,das aus einem Gesamtpaket aus Story, Rätseln und Grafik besteht.

18228236.review:
I actually liked this one. HO games of this series tend to have the same features
- a female protagonist
- a somewhat bad voice acting
- beautiful art
- a kind-of-silly story.

This, like all the others, has all of these features. While other titles (like Alice's Journey or Tales of Glass and Ink) are however dull, boring and feel too easy and lacking a decent storyline, this is one of the best of the series. The story actually has somekind of a sense with an ending that surprised me a little -which is way more than you can ask for with these games-, interesting minigames and the genuine ability to make you want to finish the game, which is not something that one should underestimate. Again, like all HO games it is not worth more than a couple pounds, and it should be bought when on discount. Other than that though, it is a very enjoyable couple of hours. Strongly Recommended, especially if one is -like me- weirdly drawn to this kind of games despite their silliness.

18227810.review:
Игра жанра "квест". Как типичный представитель своего рода - ориентирован на женскую часть геймеров, именно им почему-то больше нравиться тыкать в экран курсором в бесцельном поиске предметов и решать "головоломки" из разряда "догадаться применить туалетную бумагу к грязному анусу, чтоб герой наконец-то одел штаны". +自带简体中文版

+良好的画面和尚可的音乐、音效
CG部分3D效果不错，正常游戏场景的3D一般，两者相切换时略显生硬。不过游戏、回忆和CG三者的画面风格的不小差距使游戏不那么单调。音乐和音效一般，总体来说恐怖气氛还行。

-到处都是的名词翻译问题
剧情部分翻译基本没有错误，但是关于物品名称的翻译颇有点让人哭笑不得。很多低级的名词翻译错误让人觉得这是不是照着词典一个一个词查出来的翻译。比如“铲子”（Spade）翻译成了“黑桃牌”等等。虽然并不是特别影响游戏进程，但是作为一个主要玩法位物品寻找的游戏，名词翻译错误还是挺让人头疼的。
-场景重复
同一个物品搜寻场景多次使用，本以为已经搜刮干净的场景，随着剧情的进展又得回来重新搜刮一次，颇有些让人蛋痛。
-部分剧情与对话中人物和语音未对整


总评：8/10

17766953.review:
First game in a present three game series.

Story: Museum Director Sarah Black is putting together an exhibition surrounding pirates and one pirate captain in particular, Captain Henry Remington.  Unwittingly Sarah triggers 'ancient' magic and revives the cursed Captain.  Captain Remington upon his revival steals Sarah's daughter, Cory.  Of course, Sarah follows and stows away on Captain Remington's summoned "ghost" ship as it sets sail for Captain Remington's island.  As Captain Remington's story unfolds the player discovers his personal history, his cursed 'life' and why he stole Sarah's daughter.  Sarah with the help of a surprising ally convinces Captain Remington that what he wants to do will only cause more tradegy.

Gameplay is basically set up to occur in three distinct arenas, the museum, Remington's ship, and Remington's island.  The tragic tale of Captain Remington is revealed through the various characters (mostly his undead crew, who were cursed when he was, assuming the player talks to them).  Rather reminscent of the 'Pirates of Caribbean' first movie and the tale of 'The Flying Dutchman'.   Captain Remington's entire tale is told by the Guardian of Remington's chest, which contains the collateral of Remington's Davy Jone's bargain, whenever coins are found and given to the Guardian.  Very keeping with the Davy Jones motif and legends.     

The puzzles are classic, nothing hard or head scratching.  The game even includes a 'treasure hunt'.  (When I saw the 'treasure' map, it reminded me of 'Treasure Island'.)  There are enough hidden object scenes to keep this a Hidden Object game.  The puzzles and hidden objects scenes are intergrated well enough into the storyline that they do not stand out, which in my opinion is a very good thing.  However, since the gameplay arenas are limited to three areas there is a lot of back and forth movement within the area until everything is completed.  Some may find this annoying but the amount of things needed to be done and accomplished within the area keeps the gameplay moving.        

Being the first Artifex Mundi game I have ever played I found I enjoyed the well written storyline as well as the overall gameplay.  This game would and did bring me back to buy more, not only of this series, but other games by them, as well.

17665880.review:
This is kinda like The Book of Unwritten Tales, except that it is good.

Besides the traditional point and click, Nightmares from the Deep is fuuuuuull of minigames and minipuzzles that award you an object to allow you progress the story. Most notably, often they present you a messy Scene of Hidden Objects, in which you have to find a list of many items, after which you are awarded with one single object. If you don't like the Hidden Objects minigame, you can replace it for a match of Mahjong without any side effect. Other than the Hidden Objects minigames, the objects are never really "hidden", which is great.

Contrary to some other games of the genre (*cough cough* BoUT *cough cough*) the puzzles here make a lot of sense. You will never find yourself thinking "I'd never expect to use bettles for this!". Still in this comparison, NotD will not present you with jokes and puns befitting a primary school kid (which is definitely a plus if you're not one). The developers from NotD do not seem to despise any specific other genre of games either, or if they do, they do not sign their game with that. Respect is definitely a plus, unconditionally.

About the bad, the graphics suck at some points specially the talking animations, and the voice acting is dull, which is weird since some of the CG scenes are pretty decent. The game is not FullHD, fullscreen just stretches it. The story is very cliché too. The game is quite short as well.

If you like puzzles get this game. You're going to have some fun, though not much of a challenge. If you want graphics and fireworks, you'll potentially get disappointed.

17555494.review:
[h1]Artifex Mundi delivers usual quality, but only that[/h1]

Anyone who has already played an Hidden Object Game by Artifex Mundi, knows that this developer delivers beautifully designed games, which form the best the genre currently has to offer. The first game in the [i]Nightmares from the Deep[/i] series does not disappoint and proves to be another fine release from Artifex Mundi. However, the game does show its "age" a little bit: it was actually already released early in 2012, and this shows – it's not as meticuously polished as Artifex Mundi's more recent releases.

Don't take me wrong: I enjoyed playing this game, but I didn't felt "drawn in" as much as by other games from Artifex Mundi. This was mainly due to the voice-acting of the different characters, which proved something of a disappointment. This is a pity, since the story itself is more than interesting and offers  a nice twist on the well-known "Pirates of the Caribbean" theme, although the ending could hardly be more cliché.

Somehow the different elements of the game – point-and-click, hidden object scenes, puzzles and cutscenes – didn't add up for me to something really engrossing. Most of the separate elements are perfectly fine, with the hidden object scenes standing out as beautifully drawn as ever. The puzzles range from very easy to moderately difficult, and add some variety to the gameplay. I was especially pleased to find the option to choose for a game of Mohjang instead of the different hidden object scenes., with the Mohjang games gradually increasing in "difficulty". The music in this kind of games often strikes me as bland, but that's just a matter of personal taste I guess.

As is well-known among collectors of achievements, games by Artifex Mundi offer excellent possibilities to achieve perfect games without too much difficulty. As usual, two playthroughs are needed for this, but both need to be on the same profile in order to let all the achievements unlock. Something to keep in mind, as I made the mistake of starting the second one on a new profile, and playing through it for a third time would be stretching it way too far ;-).

[b]Overall conclusion: recommended, mainly to fans of the Hidden Object Genre[/b]

17515155.review:
I'm not the sort to prejudice games over things like their being hidden object puzzlers; and the Artifex Mundi games are by far the best examples of the genre. Nonetheless A.M. has followed the method of if it isn't broke don't fix it, meaning they reuse their puzzles with cosmetic variations from one game to another. This has the unfortunate result that if you've played one of their games you've played them all.

That's O.K. if you think of the games as more visual novels with bonus puzzle content. Granted the writing isn't amazing; but it isn't bad either. I know I've yet to play an A.M. game I could make myself stop playing before the end. That's, on average, over 3 hours in one sitting. And, most of their games include a bonus chapter that extends gameplay another hour.

They do manage to do this without unnecessarily padding game length that overstays its welcome. I know that doesn't sound like much in an industry with triple AAA titles that boast hundred of hours of gameplay. But, for cheap casual games this is an achievement.

My recommendation, because of the "if you've played one you've played them all" problem, is pare your selections down to their better games. That would be Enigmatis 2 (but not the mediocre Enigmatis: the Ghosts of Maple Creek) as a top pick, Grim Legends 1 & 2 if you liked that, and the Nightmares from the Deep trilogy if you just can't get enough of these games.

For some reason, though, this particular game has some of the worst translation errors I've ever seen. I finished it some tme back, so I can't remember specifics other than spending over half an hour on one scene, with my husband looking over my shoulder, trying to find what they called an "onion," only to discover through sheer random clicking that they really meant "(a string of) garlic." There were at least half a dozen instances like this throughout the game, into the bonus chapter, and it's severely annoying as well as a huge strike against a HOG. 

If you like HOGs, I'd recommend picking this up, but only if you get it on a good sale.

16946279.review:
说实话这家厂的游戏我买了很多个，买的目的一个是有中文，一个是很容易拿全成就（最多通关个2，3次），再说解密类游戏比较休闲，目前买的这么多里面这一部最蛋疼。
首先，要玩家扮演一个女儿都十多岁了的中年妇女就够蛋疼了，该公司其他游戏流程普遍一小时左右。唯独这个，总流程3小时，关键他剧情还很弱，之所以流程这么长，全是卡在各种机关上，不是这个门缺一块就是那个雕像少2块，玩久了有很强的厌烦感。而且本作新加入了失败的麻将系统（说是麻将其实就是连连看），还有好几个成就跟麻将有关，导致乐趣大大降低。
本作也不是没优点，起码他是该公司为数不多通关时讲清楚故事来龙去脉的作品之一，（该公司其他解密游戏通关了连故事剧情都不知道），而且是典藏版，里面加了原画，额外游戏等，也算物有所值。此外本作画面比起其他作品略有加强。
总之 该公司的解密类游戏我也买了5个了，这个最蛋疼，通关一次连玩第二次的兴趣都没有，成就也没拿完，推荐你买其他解密游戏

16867443.review: Normally I don't play or even recommend hidden object type games as I have in the past seen them as sub-par.  But I have to admit that once I found  this developer - "Artifex Mundi sp. z o.o. " I was hooked on their games.  I had so much fun in this game that I actually played through it 3 times (mostly to get the achievements, but yes I enjoyed it too).  So - gameplay was good, I had no issues at all.  Puzzles were challenging without being ridiculous.  There is a hint system but I didn't use it.  The game follows a story so all of the puzzles are story driven and themed.  There is a great mix of puzzle types in addition to the hidden object puzzles.  I got all of the achievements in 3 play throughs - the last being a speed play for myself.  For this type of game I feel that this is a very, very good game so I give it a 10/10 and my enthusiastic thumbs up.

16822653.review:
This Hidden Object game is one of the best on steam, this is the collectors edition of this game even though it listed as the standard version.  There are storytelling sections including vivid 3d visuals combined with some of the best voice acting for pirates in a pirate game even better than Assassins Creed Black Flag.  This story has it all from Mystery, to Action, to even Romance!  It does all these things, and does them all really well.  

Difficulty for players would be a bit above normal.    No worries if stuck, there i a fully illustrated strategy guide, a puzzle skip option, and a hint button for puzzles so anyone will be able to finish the game.  The map is structured well with clues leading to more clues not just random running around to check every part of the game.  The ability to play the game and have it progress as you move makes it one of the few Hidden Object games that can be used for speed runs.

Completionist Advice:
The game has many achievement bugs, best way to avoid these seems to play the first game through on expert doing all of the hidden Object Puzzles using no hints and skipping no puzzles.  Collect all the coins, do not put them in one by one, and when you have 12 coins put them all in.  Second playthrough on normal do Mahjong instead of HIdden Object puzzles to clean up the rest.  The hardest is to beat a puzzle in under one minute best done on second playthrough on the first couple puzzles, just click like crazy!


*Would be 10/10 Perfection but achievement bugs knock off a point.
Rating:  9/10  Value:  9.99

16608041.review:
I'm very close to starting to NOT recommend these Artifex Mundi casual point-and-click adventrure Hidden Object Games (HOG).  It's nothing particular to this "Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart" game.  It's more of a recurring motif problem.  To wit, their Achievements combined with the inability to either save a game or just plain quit a game and start over.  In this case, I'd made my first run through on Casual and doing the HOGs.  So, I started up another run on Expert and was working on the Mahjong games in place of the HOGs.  About a quarter of the game in, I realized I'd just done a HOG instead of a Majong (i.e., I'd messed up the Achievement).  Without a way to restore a save or just quit and start over, I'd have to finish the entire game knowing I couldn't get the Achievement and restart another run.  No.  Not gonna happen.  So, I'm upset, frustrated, and uninstalling the game.

Now, as to the game itself, it's a little below par for Artifex Mundi.  For some reason, it's a bit hard to see the objects in the HOGs.  Also, there are a lot of cases where you get stuck, only to realized that a HOG has popped up somewhere on the map that you'd otherwise have no reason to re-visit.  If a HOG re-activates like that, there should be a quest type of task that would take you back to the area to see the now-active HOG.  And, finally, the voice work (heck, even the role) of the protagonist's daughter is really annoying.

Other than that, it's pretty much a standard Artifiex Mundi HOG (decent graphics, mostly tolerable voice acting, and reasonable puzzles).  I got about 3.6 hours out of my first run.  If I'd gone on to continue the last run, I'd probably have gotten about 5-1/2 to 6 hours of "enjoyment" out of it.  So, if you decide to buy it, I'd suggest getting it on sale.

16446057.review:
The Cursed Heart is the first installment of Nightmares from the Deep series by Artifex Mundi. Next installments of the series as follows: The Siren's Called and Davy Jones.


[h1]Review[/h1]

Game Menu Option: Two section – Volume and Miscellaneous settings. The volume section has the following: Music and Sound. The miscellaneous section has the following: Custom Cursor, Voice Overs, Expert Mode and Full Screen. Wide Screen is automatically supported in the game.

Game Difficulty Modes: Two game difficulty modes – Regular and Expert.

Cinematic/Dialogue: All cinematic scenes can be skipped if you do not want to watch them. They can be watch over again under the video section the extras. There is an option for skipping the entire dialogue scene without having sit through it.

Lip Sync Dialogues: Most of the time, the movement of the mouths does not match up with the dialogues; it is noticeable if you pay really close attention.

Voiceovers: Nothing much can be said about the voice overs asides from that they are well done.

Game Music/Sounds: Nothing much can be said about the music/sounds asides from that they fit well with the game.

Game Graphics: Nothing much can be said about the graphics asides from that they are nicely drawn with a painted feel to them.

Inventory Panel: There is no inventory lock feature but it does slides up and down.

Notebook: Two section – Notes and Objectives. Notes section is for the story and clues from the game. Objectives section is for all the objective from the game and the completed ones are checked off.

Map: The map is a non-interactive one. However, it does have useful indicators; map icons/markers. The legend on the map explains the function for each of the map icons.

Hidden Object Gameplay: Fragmented, Traditional word list with some and/or no interaction required. For the traditional word only, the sonar feature show you the shape of the item. All hidden object scenes, excluding the fragmented scenes, can be replayed through the extra section of the game.

Mahjong Gameplay: This game feature is optional for those who don’t want to go looking for items in hidden object scenes.

Puzzle Gameplay: Most of the puzzles are fairly easy to solve. There is a skip button if the puzzle(s) becomes too tasking to solve.

Game Ending: There is somewhat an ending in the main portion of the game but the bonus chapter extends it a bit more.

Game Achievements: Most of these achievements are featured in Steam’s achievements. There are total of fifteen achievements in the game with different requirements. They can be only earned in the main portion of the game.

Game Concept Art/Wallpapers: Nine concept art and Eight wallpapers. These two sections does not requires the main of portion of the game to completed in order to access them.

Game Strategy Guide: It can be only access in-game and not from the main menu of the game.

Game Length: There are nine chapters in total; Seven for the main portion of the game and Two for the bonus portion of the game. The bonus chapter can be accessed when the main portion of the game is completed.

Game Trading Card/Badge: This a special feature only available in the Steam’s version of the game. The game drops three different trading cards only once and the rest of the cards: Community Market, Booster Packs and Trading. The game badge can be crafted after having all the card in the inventory then it can be upgraded four more times.

16000583.review:
Hidden object and adventure.

Highs:
I was impressed by the animation that went into portions of the game.  It went beyond the usual throw-in story of most hidden object adventures. 
The plot was decent and you were reminded pretty constantly of what was going on by contextual clues.  
The location of the next hidden-object puzzle is usually hidden in the most-current location (a picture, etc) otherwise you can just spam the hint button and it will get  you to the right area.
High resolution puzzles made it easy to pick out the items that were required and lots of hidden object puzzles were present in the game (with only a couple of exceptions)

Lows:
The doubling back to the "guardian" to unlock the chest that takes like 20 doubloons to open was kind of annoying.  It isn't required throughout the game, but that's not made apparent while you're playing.
A couple of the puzzles had sections that were a bit hazy and fuzzy on large monitors.

All in all, this was a good game.  I enjoyed the story.  Not so much the fact that you were a talking character (and female at that) which disconnected me from the main character a bit.  But, still it's a game and it was a good one even if some of the sequences were pretty obvious.

15940982.review:
O jogo, do tipo Puzzle/Hidden objects, é muito bem feito, e um dos melhores que já joguei até o momento.

Pontos positivos:
> Os gráficos são bonitos, os cenários são muito bem desenhados.
> A dificuldade é moderada, ótimo para quem gosta de jogos casuais (isto pode ser considerado ponto negativo para alguns jogadores)
> A história é bem elaborada e interessante

Pontos negativos:
> É curto. Só tem valor de replay se você estiver atrás de todas as conquistas. Neste caso você precisa de pelo menos duas jogadas.
> Não existe "fast travel", ou seja, você quer voltar a um aposento no início do jogo, tem que passar por todos os outros até chegar lá.
> A tradução para o português em alguns momentos não é apropriada. Isto causa um pouco de confusão na busca pelos objetos escondidos na cena. Exemplo: Eu estava procurando por uma bússola, mas o objeto correto era um compasso (que vêm da mesma palavra em inglês).

Recomendação final: Recomendo, mas aconselho esperar uma promoção.

15902621.review:
Das Museum steht Kopf! Der Leichnam des legendären Seeräubers Remington ist samt Requisiten eingetroffen, doch etwas scheint nicht ganz zu stimmen. Eine stürmische Nacht, mysteriöse Ereignisse und plötzlich ist Remington verschwunden! Als auch noch ein Geisterschiff in das Museum kracht und die Tochter der Kuratorin (Spieler-Charakter) auf eine weit entfernte Spukinsel entführt, wird es Zeit für Mama ihr Kind zu retten!

Als Auftakt der Nightmares from the Deep-Serie bietet The Cursed Heart 3 wirklich lustige Spielstunden. Die Kulissen sind herrlich schaurig gestaltet und die Tonkulisse weiß mit tollen Umbegungsgeräuschen zu punkten. Die untoten Gesellen, die wir in unserem Abenteuer treffen sind zumeist ordentlich vertont (nur auf Englisch), wobei die Hauptfiguren der Geschichte die besten SprecherInnen abbekommen haben.

The Cursed Heart ist kein simples Wimmelbild-Spiel, sondern siedelt sich für Artifex Muni typisch im Adventure-Bereich an. Es gibt kleine Logikaufgaben, Kombinationsrätsel und selbstverständlich viele toll gestaltete Wimmelbilder. Insgesamt sollten erfahrene Adventure-SpielerInnen keine großen Probleme haben die Aufgaben zu lösen, da die Schwierigkeitsstufe auf einem sehr niedrigen Level gehalten wird. Ein Blick in die Hilfe ist im Grunde nicht nötig.

Genre-Anfänger bekommen hier einen guten Start in dieses spannende Genre, doch auch Freunde von Gelegenheits-Abenteuern sollten einen Blick riskieren.

15899210.review:
One of the better HOGs I've played on steam, a very enjoyable game. For being all haunted pirate themed, it's not too scary, only a few very mild jumpscares in the game.

You play a museum conservator who is about to display the corpse of the legendary pirate captain Remington in your museum. You manage to wake him up and he kidnaps your daughter in his haunted ship. You'll have none of that and axe your way into his ship to get her back. 

There are two areas; the haunted ship and Skull Island. The difficulty of both the hidden object scenes and other minigames is pretty good, neither too hard nor too easy. If you're stuck on a hidden object scene, you can choose to play mahjong instead. in the mahjong there are a few matches of different colour that takes away one HO item each, you can switch back and forth or just play either. There is however an achievement for both playing all mahjong games and finding all HO items without using hint, so an achievement completeist will have to play the game through twice. Luckily for that all conversation and cutscenes are skippable.

All HO scenes are used more than once, and all found items are removed each time, making the 3rd go around pretty easy. 

The art is beautiful, the voice acting is good and the music and sound effects set a good haunted-pirate themed mood. The animations in the cutscenes is probably the worst part of the game; they get so bad it feels blurry. 

The story is very good, to save your daughter you have to find out what's going on with the pirate captain and you learn his story through collecting and handing in dubloons to the pirate's cute-creepy companion.

There are maps available on both locations but they're useless as it only tells you where you are and cannot be used for teleporting or seeing if an area is cleared.

Highly recommended for any fan of HOGs, pirates or really games in general.

15897357.review:
Auftakt eines Albtraumes aus der Tiefe, eines Piraten, der in seiner Zeit blutig wütete und sich später in eine Frau verliebte, die ihn auf die Seite der Tugend zurückholt.

Die Story ist hervorragend inszeniert, jedoch etwas 0815, im Gegensatz zur Fortsetzung, die ich etwas interessanter finde, auch wenn sie sich auch einigen bereits bekannten Aspekten bedient.
Die ewige Piratenliebe, eines ehemals blutrünstigen klingt in meinen Ohren nicht gerade unbekannt, auch wenn ich außer einem Indie-Game gerade keinen Film oder Buch, etc. in Erinnerung habe...
Aber egal!

Die Grafik ist die gewohnte gute Qualität, die Zwischensequenzen sehen ebenfalls sehr schön aus und passen sich stimmig in das Gesamtbild.
Die Rätsel bewegen sich dabei auf Standartniveau und bieten wenig unbekanntes, bzw. komplett neues.
Sound und Vertonung die in Englisch ist, sind nicht gut, die Sprecher klingen nicht gelangweilt, jedoch teilweise etwas zu überzogen weiblich... was im Gegensatz zur Hartnäckigkeit der Hauptcharakterin etwas komisch anmutet.

Die Übersetzung ist bis auf einige typische Fehler ordentlich, auffallend, wie immer das selbst Wimmelbild-Szenen nicht 100% richtig sind... Kreuz-Ass für einen Knüppel mit Stacheln...

Fazit: Der aktuelle Preis von 8 Euro ist in Ordnung für Liebhaber, alle anderen, wartet bis zum Sale!

15648609.review:
A very well done hidden object point and click adventure game! The story wasn't that interesting but it was a decent backdrop to the fun puzzles. It was also a bit odd how they told basically the whole story in the first quarter of the game but then every time you collected a dubloon you'd get pieces of the story. I kept waiting for the dubloon cut scenes to tell me something I didn't already know but they didn't. Not saying it was a bad way to tell it, just kind of unnecessary? Oh well. 

The puzzles were fun. I liked how interactive they were. A lot of the times you didn't just assemble the items and click them on to the screen but you actually had to follow instructions and pick up a tool to manipulate different things, etc. I really thought that made the game so much better than other ones I've played. I didn't get stuck or get frustrated with any of the puzzles. They were mostly pretty easy (in fact, the only time I used the hint the whole game was when I kept over looking a small item lying on the ground which I needed to pick up to progress >.<).

The hidden object puzzles were pretty good. Sometimes they were a bit weird on how they labeled things (like one where there's something that looks like a ribbon rolled up but they called it a "spring"). They also have items that need extra actions to find or complete which makes the HOPs more fun. These actions usually made sense to do so I never encountered any frustration with them like I have with other games. 

Voice acting was okay. Nothing great but nothing horrendous either. Cut scenes were cool but low resolution. 
Overall, I enjoyed it very much. The bonus adventure available through the "Extras" on the main menu is worth playing after too.

15579041.review:
The Cursed Heart is one of ArtifexMundi's first Hidden Object Games and it shows. Compared to their later games animation is nearly fully absent, voice acting is rough, and the puzzles are relatively simple.

However, that does not take away the fact this is a very good HOG entry. The story is a compelling myth which encourages you to continue playing, the AM staples of randomized hidden object puzzles are already present, and it never feels unnecessarily difficult.
And for those who have no patience to solve hidden object puzzles, you can play a simple mahjong game instead.

Definitely worth picking up, if only for the bonus adventure in this version that nicely ties the story to the sequel's.

Что я могу сказать. Игра не стоит 219 рублей определенно. Тем более с оглядкой на 2012-й год. Разумеется, если будет распродажа и вы фанат игр данного жанра - хватайте. Я поставлю 6 из 10. Почему.
Минусы.
1. Для такой цены игра неоправданно короткая. И даже "Достижения Steam" ее не спасут.
2. 2012 год не 2001 год. Графика не оправдывает ожиданий "графоманов". В 2012 можно (и было) намного лучше. А уж тем более это касается вставочных видеороликов.
3. На последних минутах игры (а игра идет реально минуты, если не отвлекаться по делам, по моим прикидкам - не больше полутора часов точно) - начинает зае...мучивать это вот бесконечное хождения туда-сюда и вот тут следующий пункт.
4. Карта мала. Локации можно пересчитать по пальцам рук, наверно. Для кого-то это плюс, для кого-то минус.
5. Игра реально глазоломна. В плане именно поиска предметов. Я, конечно, не могу похвастаться идеальным зрением... Но эту я не стала бы рекомендовать детям точно. Да и, кстати, если брать детей младшего возраста - они попросту не поймут некоторых терминов.

Но и о плюсах скажу. И все-таки рекомендую. Но именно, повторюсь, любителям данного жанра.
1. Сюжет весьма трогателен. Хотя ... ВНИМАНИЕ, СПОЙЛЕР!!! ... - лично я не вижу смысла приплетения туда вот линии "спасение дочки мамой" - так себе смотрится. Кто-то писал, что игра для девочек - ну хрен знает.
2. Настолько трогателен !СПОЙЛЕР! , что я ловила себя на мысли, что бегу скорее к "Сундуку мертвеца" в обход всех зон, чтоб послушать еще часть истории.
3. И снова повторюсь. Игра для фанатов жанра, бесспорно. Присутствует морская тематика, которую именно я лично люблю.

Но не больше.

Как итог. С технической части игры - плюсов для меня нет вообще. Головоломки достаточно дурные, нудные. Если уж только прямо вот сидеть часами и вникать во все ради ачивок в Стиме. Графика не айс совершенно. Сижет мил, конечно, трогателен. Но тривиален.

Конец мне не понравился. Для девочек игра? А где же вот хэппи-энд, где там они такие все молодеют и уходят в закат? !СПОЙЛЕР! Не молодеют они. Но в закат уходят.

Однако же - это редкий случай, когда я решила написать свое мнение об игре. Посему, как писала в самом начале, ежели будет распродажа - хватайте. Пара часиков незамысловатого отдыха обеспечены. =)

15288540.review: This is the game that made me take the hidden object genre seriously.  Aside from having a great storyline, gorgeous graphics, and some well designed puzzles, The Cursed Heart is tremendously atmostpheric.  It also has enough different tasks in the game to make it not feel like a back to back needle in the haystack hunt.  I would recommend this game to all hidden object fans as well as gamers who are willing to give hidden object adventure games a chance.  The Cursed Heart offers an all around great experience.  8.5/10

15259854.review:
This is the first real Hidden Object Game that i've ever played. I say "real", because I played games on flash sites, and facebook which labeled themselves as such, but this is the first high quality one i've played. The first thing that surprised me was that the game wasn't JUST hidden objects like it's Facebook cousins. It was hidden objects+Classic point and click inventory based adventure game! I loved it!

[h1]PROS[/h1]
-Fantastic graphics! Seriously, the art is amazing!
-Creative, but not insanely difficult puzzles.
-Fun and entertaining storyline.
-The ability to skip hidden item sections and play a game of mahjong instead.

[h1]CON[/h1]
Bad voice acting, zombie pirates sound so polite, and Captain Remington literally sounds like he's reading his lines. You can hear in mid sentence, when he is having to continue reading from another line and/or page. It's just bad.

15231661.review:
Mein erstes Wimmelbildspiel/Adventuredingens und gleich kommplett in den Bann gezogen.
Selten hat mich ein Spiel so gefesselt, das ich nach der ersten Spielsession nicht sagen konnte, ob ich 20 Minunten oder 4 Stunden gespielt hab. 

Logische Rätzel, schöne Hintergründe und einfach toll.
Absoluter Kauftipp (und das von einem, der sonst RPGs und Shooter spielt :))

15224909.review:
I would suggest playing one of Artifex Mundi’s newer titles first as this lacks some finesse in comparison.

-	The graphics and setting are very pretty and atmospheric
-	The puzzles require imagination
-	You will need to complete the game twice to experience everything
-	This is the collector’s edition and contains a nice finish to the story via the extras menu
-	The extras menu also contains some lovely artwork, wallpapers and hidden object puzzles
-       Oh and this game forced me to learn how to play mah-jong properly lol :/

Overall a very enjoyable and addictive experience.

15171182.review:
作为深海梦魇的第一部作品，这一作明显有种资金不足的感觉。
剧情还算有点新意，不是封印恶魔的老套桥段。
可操作性一般，道具动作只能说并不粗糙。
由于是先期作品，游戏的不足之处很多也很明显。
游戏有地图却不能实现场景跳跃，浪费时间很多是在路程上。
CG说不上精美，只能说动作还比较圆润，但是不会随着道具而改变。
不过总算知道乌鸦林之谜2里那个放一块硬币讲一段神话故事的构思是从哪来的了。
人物口型和对话明显不搭，甚至最后女儿说话时候嘴一直是闭着的。
总体来说只能算一般中等的作品，比下有余，比上不足。
有兴趣消磨时间的可以试着玩一下。

15134980.review: If you're going to start playing hidden object games, start here.  Cheesy, engaging, well paced, great art, sound is perfect for the experience, this is great experience to truly endear the genre with new players.  I recommend this one highly.

15130772.review: Artifex games are great. Excellent story and graphics. Get all 3

15051193.review:
Kolejna przyjemna gra z pięknymi, szczegółowymi tłami studia Artifex Mundi. Na początku wydarzenia w historii wydawały mi się przezabawne, ale im dalej w las tym historia kapitana Henry'ego Remington'a jest coraz bardziej przygnębiająca. Wrażenie to potęguje później muzyka. 
Warto kupić - w szczególności na promocji :)

15034347.review:
Do not buy this game if you want deep strategy or action.
Do not buy this game if badly recorded audio offends your ear holes.
Do not buy this game for full retail, but this is Steam, so that pretty much goes without saying.

Do buy if you want a quick hidden object game with puzzles that are very easy to solve. You'll feel slightly smarter for the 3 hour play time. If you know what you're getting into (and if you get it in a bundle,) this is a recommend.

15028276.review:
Picked up my first hidden object game on sale. didn't expect much from the game, but it was a nice and forgiving introduction to the genre. The game is short and the story isn't much of one if anything, but the puzzles can be fun for the 30 seconds they last and getting around is quick and easy

As most other reviews say, the sound quality is bad and i found it annoying that the lips didn't sync with the voice audio. On another note, trying to play this at 1080p in fullscreen caused the image to noticeably resize itself each scene. Not sure whether that was my own fault or not, but there are only a handful of options in the game and resolution done automatically through the game. I ended up just playing in window mode to avoid this especially since i knew the game was short. The only other thing i can think to say is that my mouse had lag issues during the game which required me to adjust my DPI on the mouse software itself as there is no mouse sensitivty setting in game.

I cant judge the game too harshly because i haven't played any other of the genre. i would say that if it weren't pirate themed i wouldn't have an interest in it. If you are interested wait for a sale. I wouldn't purchase this game or any of the sequels at full price.

14993407.review: Part hidden object, part puzzle-solving, part nautical mystery. It won't test your skills or patience, which is more than most games of this sort can say. If you're looking for a time-waster that isn't too demanding, check this one out (when it's on sale).

14937733.review:
A good hidden object game for kids, maybe up to teen years.

Very responsive on a MacBook, very little wait between locations. Character animations left a lot to be desired in many locations. Voice acting was acceptable. Story / plot was there and not bad, but left me wanting for something more… polish, content, decisions and consequences, etc.. The game has good ideas and potential which a small studio probably doesn’t have resources to fulfill, which limits the audience age.

14909172.review: This is a good game, part of a good series. The story and voice acting are a bit sub par, but the art work is lovely and the puzzles are engaging. 14839602.review: 剧情很不错，很连贯，画风也很不错，很舒适，点个赞，好游戏，你值得拥有

14822201.review: 游戏还挺不错的，可玩挺高。不过就是游戏时间太短。我4个小时就通关了，速度快的可能只需要3个小时吧。希望油续作。

14819250.review:
前に紹介したパズルゲームの前作です。
その主人公の母親の話ですがやることはそう変わっていません。

個人的にはこっちの方がシナリオ的にはよかった感じがします。
特になにか奇想天外なことをやっているわけではないのですが..
あとは次回作を先にやったことでこのゲームシステムの流儀が
わかったのも大きな要因かもしれません。
パズル遊びが好みならいいでしょうが
是非プレイしてもらいたい作品レベルでないのが残念なところです。
軽いゲームでゆっくりしたいならいいかもしれません。
ただ、がっちりと遊びたい人にはちょっとお奨めするには厳しいレベルかと思います。

実績的には
ノーマルで一周、エキスパートで一周が必要かと思います。
どっちにしろ実績全部とるには二周しないといけません。

一周目でノーマルで物探し、
二周目でエキスパートでマージャン(上海といえばいいかな..)で
すべてやれば問題ないです。
さらに一周目ではヒントをまったく使わず地図をみながら
目的地に移動すれば次の行動内容にも問題ないので
一周目からでもヒントを使う必要もないです。
ただ、一部アイテムないとクリアできないのに行動可能地点に設定されているようなので
なにもできなさそうで他に行動可能エリアがあればそっちに移動すればいいかと思います。
ボーナスシナリオもありますが実績には何も影響なさそうです。
内容も特に加味する点もない内容だったりします。
ちなみにマージャンゲームも本編のみしかカウントされていなかったです。

14793205.review:
Como jugador habitual de jugos HO, he de decir que simplemente me ha encantado. Combina no solo un argumento creíble al juego sino que une todos los elementos del género sin caer en los malos puntos que suelen contener.

Además de añadir una cosa que había echado en falta en muchos juegos. El concepto de que si encuentras una serie de objetos y has de rejugar la zona, estos objetos ya no están, pero a cambio, no pierde dificultad en encontrar los objetos en la siguiente rejugabilidad. 

Y cuando piensas que ya esta todo hecho, te dan la posibilidad de jugar de forma alternativa a los juegos mahjong, lo que le da mayor rejugabilidad. 

Considero que es si no el mejor, de los mejores juegos que he jugado en el géro y que vale la pena comprarlo.

14777524.review: This game was cool for what it is, a story-telling hidden object game. Personally, the daughter of your character is really irritating and constantly having to revisit every spot on the map can get really old really fast. The story was cool and the artwork is unique. Overall, I'd give this game a 2.5 out of 5, your children may get more out of it than you.

14777472.review:
It’s a point-n-click adventure with hidden-object scenes. For the genre it is very good: the object interaction is logical, there’s a useful map, the pirate-based story is interesting (if a little clichéd), good artwork and it has lots of little videos to show events. If this genre interests you, I would definitely recommend it, because it’s the best of these that I've played. It also has a few extra things, like wallpapers, a hint system and a puzzle replay menu.

If you hate hidden-object scenes, the game gives you the option to play mah-jong instead.

14752754.review: If you like hidden object games and it doesn't bother you that history seems a bit like Pirate of the caribbean, the game is for you. Personally, I had fun to play this little game.

14735358.review: Moje první "hidden object" hra předčila všechna má očekávání. Nečekal jsem nic extra a dostal jsem zajímavý morbidní příběh, nádherně vykreslené lokace a spoustu zábavy. Přitom se nejedná jen o hledání skrytých objektů - hra je doslova prošpikovaná logickými puzzly, které jsou náročné tak akorát, aby lehce pošimraly mozkové závity. Člověk se nikdy nezasekne na tak dlouho, aby ho to otrávilo či začalo nudit. Skvěle to odsýpá a má to hlavu a patu. Všem vřele doporučuji a už se moc těším na další díly. :)

14734175.review:
简单地说，整个游戏围绕一位勇敢而聪慧、上哪儿都能找到地图的妈妈展开。讲的是邪恶的、已经死了好几百年的反派大暴死，因为无法接受当年斯德哥尔摩综合症发作才嫁给她的结发妻子现如今又老又丑的现实，抓走了主角风华正茂发育良好的女儿想拿回家做童养媳。不想主角四十猛如虎，用一把破梯子就登上了他的破船。在一群逗比骷髅船员和一只只知道伸手要钱，不给钱就不讲故事的老骷髅的帮助下，最终成功拯救女儿，并感化了大暴死的故事。（雾……）

绕了点弯路6.5小时才全成就通关游戏。这类游戏永远通用的关键就是务必先看成就要求再进行游戏，这就像做阅读理解一定要先看问题再读文章一样，是很重要的事。同公司同系列游戏中难度比较适中的一款，唯一的缺点就是地图没有快速移动，场景多了以后略微有点麻烦。

14572171.review: 作为一款手机游戏移植过来的解密类游戏，三个小时的流程（加奖励关卡）不短。但是对于一款PC游戏来说，三个小时确实蛋疼点了。另外，移植未针对PC作画面上的优化，整个画面看着有点模糊感，这就是低分辨率的材质的动画所致的。Anyway，如果你不介意流程太短，也能忍受画质很渣的过场动画，那么这款解密类游戏一定能让你眼前一亮。毕竟剧情还是不错的，制作也算精良且自带简体中文，翻译也属中上乘水准。五刀以下可以考虑入手。

14560362.review:
Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart ist ein Abenteuer-Wimmelbild-Spiel, dessen Geschichte sich um einen verfluchten Piratenkapitän dreht. Das ganze findet auf einem alten Piratenschiff und einer verschollenen Pirateninsel statt.

Gameplay, Grafik und Atmosphäre sind wunderschön gestaltet und werden bis zum Ende aufrechterhalten.

Als Alternative zu den Wimmelbildern werden Mahjong-Minispiele angeboten. Somit sind für 100% Errungenschaftsfortschritt zwei komplette Durchläufe nötig.

Die Spielzeit für einen Durchlauf (mit Bonuskapitel) dauert ca. vier Stunden.

Klare Kaufempfehlung von mir!

14333148.review: 超级好玩，和迷画之塔一样经典的解谜游戏。自带中文好评。游戏里面麻将这个设置比较鸡肋，没难度，应该设置成没有匹配的就失败重来比较好。还有有些地方用工具要点好几下，不如直接设置成点一下自动挖来的快。附加关卡好顶赞，超爱，简直惊喜。唯独游戏中切不到桌面去让人不爽。

간만에 몰입하면서 즐긴 어드벤쳐게임.

14227876.review:
アイテム探しカジュアルゲームの傑作の一つ。グラフィックに滲む多少の安っぽさは否めないがＢＧＭとストーリーテリングは優れていて、ゲームを進めると共に次第に世界に引き込まれていく。パズルの難度やデザインも良く各種ヒント機能も親切で、実際のプレイ時間以上に長く楽しめた印象が残る。このジャンルのゲームが嫌いでないなら、迷わずオススメいたします。

アイテム探しの代わりに麻雀パズル（上海）を選ぶオプションがついているのは謎仕様。実績の四割がこの麻雀に結びついているため、全獲得には最低二周プレイしないとならない。良く出来たゲームとはいえ繰り返し体験したいほどの物語かといえば微妙なので……達成率にこだわりのある人は覚悟して買ってください。

14167414.review:
Wow. Talk about being positively surprised!
I went into this expecting nothing more than bare-bones hidden-object fun, and ended up actually getting invested in the story! Granted, the "frame story" of you being a museum director trying to rescue her daughter (only referred to, again and again, as "My daughter" - apparently you never named her) is a little wonky, but once you get to Skull Island things change: Slowly you start to learn more about Captain Henry Remington and his fate and his story is... surprisingly well done!

The game has a strange Mahjong alternative to the hidden object-scenes (probably put in there for people who don't like hidden object puzzles but then... why would you have bought this game to begin with?), and those can be fun as well - although you tire of them quickly.
Then there's the point-and-click puzzle solving which works like an adventure game 'light' - most of the time you'll have no problem figuring out what to do (although I got stuck once or twice).

In the end, this surprised the hell out of me. I had no idea hidden object games could actually be, you know, good games!

14159681.review:
Another excellent hidden object game from Artifex Mundi. The plot holds nothing new if you've seen Pirates of the Caribbean 2 and 3, but at least it stitches the gameplay together. Oh, towards the end you get to see a neat giant crab. 

The puzzles themselves are challenging without being overly difficult, though I personally didn't care for the overabundance of 'recipe' puzzles.

All in all, a good buy.

14158155.review:
点点点啥的没必要说了吧……依然是惯例的中文好评……本作由于当年谷歌的视频拉来了不少玩家，因此中文评论相对他家的其他作品也多了一些。个人而言，本作在他家众多游戏中算是游戏时间偏长的一部，也算得上良心作。本作也有续作，个人感觉解谜比本作略好一点点，别的都差不多。

画面：我觉得本作的画面比后面几部好……后面几部有点过于鲜艳了。由于是海盗故事，所以整体的海盗元素很多，一些小物件的设计很用心。唯一的问题是过场动画分辨率稍低，而且3D有点无法直视。

剧情：这游戏的剧情也是老套的一看开头就知道结尾的节奏（他家从来不擅长剧情），虽然有点恐怖元素不过也不算太吓人。他家的剧情一贯是女主角去救个什么人，这次是老妈救女儿（话说她女儿怎么看都是一个普通的胖姑娘……）；最终也是反派被洗白+各种坑的节奏，毫无意外。流程比他家其它的作品略长一些，本人一周目专家难度大约是2-3小时通关吧（大部分时间花在了寻物上）。

解谜：嗯……单说本作的解谜还可以，除了寻物之外的部分都足够简单，80%是“从A处拿东西到B处使用”的菜鸡谜题；各位老鸟们可以开场直接专家难度通关。而且本作在高难度下有惩罚机制（画面模糊），寻物也可以通过麻将小游戏跳过，这两点好评。但是如果各位之前玩过他家的游戏的话，会感觉本作的大小谜题，尤其是小游戏部分非常模式化；而且本作的寻物又多又难，中间有很大一段游戏时间是“到A地点玩寻物之后再去B地点玩寻物”，寻物游戏本身又创意欠奉，导致本作连过剧情都很抓狂。

福利：这家的福利一直是业界良心……虽然没送原声，不过送的DLC很有料，概念图和桌面也不错。而且还有中文配音，虽然有些地方机翻的痕迹依然很明显（某个寻物的狼牙棒是贝壳上的黑桃符号），不过理解剧情是够用了。

总体而言本作算是不错的快餐作品，有福利有卡有成就，虽然全成就要二周目但是剧情动画都可以跳，喜欢的各位可以趁打折的时候入一个玩玩看。

13940783.review:
Very bad game. Unless you are 4 years old, you will not like it.
- Extremely bad narration. It makes me cringe all the time. 
- Completely random and meaningless puzzles. They never make any sense.

13814473.review:
This is well worth the buy! This game has an impressive amount of quality, and a few new twists on gameplay that I was very pleased to see! The story is enjoyable, and any romantic will be very pleased with the plot twists and turns we go through to reach the very satisfying ending.

The gameplay is excellent and will not disappoint - well-constructed, enjoyable and steadily more complex Hidden Object scenes teamed with enjoyable puzzles and a robust hint system. As with many games in this genre, they make good (if not enough) use of a map to help navigate and figure out where you need to go next. The only bit of gameplay I think they could have improved on was the map itself, as there is no quick travel option.  Which makes sense in-game context, but still means quite a bit of traveling back and forth. Honestly my only quibble with the gameplay.

Visually, it's stunning - the little bit of CG they use is well-done and matched to the artwork rather than trying to be realistic. A choice I applaud and definitely praise them for. The one bit of 'regular' CG is used for a deliberately creepy and eerie set of characters and was still a careful mix of realistic detail blended into the style of the art. The Hidden Object scenes were done in the art style of the game, not quickly patched from photos - the creators going that extra length always wins points with me. Very solid, consistent, and delightful visuals.

Which just leaves audio, and this is a spot where the game falters just a wee bit - not in the music, but in the (mostly great) voice acting. Towards the end of the game, some lines are just not delivered well, or with odd inflection. Thankfully not by any of the major characters in the ending. The sound effects are minimal but spot on, but the music . . in full honesty it's mostly forgettably pleasant and appropriate for where you're hearing it. Nothing outstanding, but at least nothing that throws you out of the mood set by the game.

Отправляйтесь в захватывающее пиратское приключение !
*****************************************************************
Вы владелец музея, преследующий пирата - нежить, который похитил вашу дочь. Вы быстро поймете, что пират запутался в трагической, многовековой истории любви и хочет воскресить свою возлюбленную, используя жизненную силу вашей дочери. 
Вам ничего не осталось сделать, только покинуть свой безопасный современный музей и отправиться на дикую, заполненную привидениями землю пирата, на которой не появлялась живая душа уже более трех веков ! Полнолуние, разбросанные по земле кости, и скала припоминающая череп добавляет этому месту темного настроения и страшной атмосферы !
*******************************************************************************************
Жанр в играх « найди предмет » набрал довольно большую популярность на различных платформах и пользуется успехом у всех возрастных категорий игроков. « Кошмары из глубины » очень качественный представитель подобного жанра, обладающий своими особенностями.
В игре очень красивые и детально прорисованные локации. Играть одно удовольствие. Движения персонажей частично анимированы, но их не так много. Плавно двигаясь по сюжету нам будут встречаться различные мини-игры - маджонг, три в ряд, найди предмет и другие.
Управление простое, поиск предметов и взаимодействие осуществляется нажатиями по экрану. Из интерфейса имеется дневник с заметками, инвентарь, и иконка подсказки. Музыка ♫  прекрасно вписывается в происходящее на экране *.
*******************************************************************************************
Игра  для тех, кто просто хочет расслабиться... и не ломать голову.
В целом - запоминающаяся и  интересная !
Приятного времяпровождения за Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart ! ツ

13691767.review:
In Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart spielen wir eine Museumskuratorin, die ihre Tochter vor einem untoten Piraten retten muss. Im Point-and-Click-Stil müssen wir Wimmelbilder (oder wahlweise Mahjongspiele) und andere Rätsel lösen, um die benötigten Gegenstände zu erhalten.
Die Schwierigkeit ist dabei moderat, die Story aber kurzweilig und schnelle Erfolge sind garantiert. Einzig in den Wimmelbildern gibt es einige unvorteilhafte Übersetzungen, sodass man nicht immer alle Gegenstände auf Anhieb findet.

13668054.review:
[b]Spielwertung:[/b] 8/10

Für alle Freunde von Wimmelbildspielen definitiv einen Blick Wert. Ein kurzweiliges Spielvergnügen mit Piratenstory. 

[b]Spieldauer:[/b] ca. 3 – 4 Stunden für den ersten Durchgang auf Normal.

+ gute Story
+ gelegentliche animierte Zwischensequenzen mit englischer Sprachausgabe
+ leichter bis mittlerer Schwierigkeitsgrad 
+ gut erreichbare Errungenschaften (erfordern aber ein zweites Mal durchspielen)
+ alternativ zum Beenden der Wimmelbildszenen kann man diese durch Mahjong lösen (für die Errungenschaften benötigt man aber beides)
+ Bonusabenteuer (ca. 1 Stunde)
+ Wallpaper und wiederholbare Suchszenen außerhalb des Spiels unter: Extras
+ (für untote Piraten) 

- Minispiele kann man nicht auf den Ursprungszustand zurücksetzen (außer wenige Ausnahmen)
- Spiel lässt sich nur dann Neustarten, wenn man es durchgespielt hat

[b]Zusammenfassung/Kommentar:[/b]

[i]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart war das erste Spiel, dass ich von Artifex Mundi gespielt habe. Inzwischen ist ein wenig Zeit vergangen und ich habe mehr Spiele von der Firma gespielt. Daher habe ich den Kommentar noch mal ein wenig überarbeitet. Ich habe ein paar Artifex Mundi typische Eigenheiten aus meinem Kommentar gestrichen. (Oktober 2015)[/i]

Ich habe dieses Spiel sehr gerne gespielt. Es hat Spaß gemacht und durch den nicht allzu hohen Schwierigkeitsgrad super geeignet, wenn man einfach mal einen Abend abspannen will. Ich habe beim ersten Mal durchspielen ca. 4 Stunden gebraucht durch Verzichten jeglicher Hinweise etc. Insgesamt habe ich mit erspielen aller Leistungen (Errungenschaften) und lösen des Bonusabenteuers ca. 10 Stunden im Spiel verbracht. Für jeden der, das Spiel nicht drei Mal durchspielen muss, wie ich, für den fällt die Zeit entsprechend kürzer aus. 

Die Story ist an sich nicht wirklich innovativ oder neu. Aber nicht schlecht. Es war interessant im Verlauf des Spiels immer mehr über die Hintergrundgeschichte von Kapitän Remington zu erfahren.

Ebenso gefallen hat mir die Bonusgeschichte, die ich irgendwie total sympathisch fand. Mit ca. einer Stunde zusätzlichen Rätseln, Wimmelbildszenen definitiv lohnenswert. 

In dem Spiel gibt es immer wieder Zwischensequenzen mit englischer Sprachausgabe. Untertitel ist deutsch. Die Animationen sind gut gemacht und passen in das Spiel. Ab und zu fand ich die Synchronisation etwas holprig. Aber für ein Wimmelbildspiel gut.

Der gesamte Schwierigkeitsgrad des Spiels liegt für mich zwischen leicht und mittel. Es gibt keine wirklichen Frustmomente in diesem Spiel. Die meisten Rätsel lassen sich gut lösen und die Wimmelbildszenen sind nicht übertrieben schwer.
Die Errungenschaften / Leistungen sind gut machbar und ebenfalls nicht übertrieben schwer zu erreichen. Erfordern aber das zweimalige Durchspielen des Spiels, wenn man 100% erreichen möchte.

Bei den Minispielen empfand ich es als leicht störend, dass man diese nicht auf ihren Ursprungszustand zurücksetzen kann. In der Regel war dies nicht nötig aber bei einem Rätsel hatte ich mich dezent vertan und hätte es begrüßt, wenn ich dieses noch mal von vorn beginnen könnte. (Die Lösung war nämlich ziemlich einfach, wenn man sich den Ausgangszustand genau angesehen hätte. *hust *)

Ebenso gibt es einen kleinen Minuspunkt dafür, dass man das Spiel nicht Neustarten kann. Man muss es immer einmal durchspielen, wenn man von vorn beginnen möchte. Aber das ist bloß eine Kleinigkeit. Es fällt auf behindert aber nicht wirklich. 

[b][i]Fazit:[/i][/b]
Alle Fans von Wimmelbildspielen dürfen ruhig zugreifen und wer gerne mal eins ausprobieren möchte kann auch gerne zugreifen. Wer sich trotzdem unsicher ist, sollte eventuell warten bis es wieder im Sonderangebot auf Steam ist.

13210246.review:
Again a HOG (Hidden Object Game)!

This one rode on the "Pirates of the Carribean"-Hype of some past years. But this "makeup" is, like all powder, rouge and gloss, only a superficial incentive to buy the game.

The background-story is a rescue-adventure, with some drama and romantics, so if you took the hint of powder and rouge and gloss, yeah it's a game aimed more for a female audience. But it doesn't break your crown to play it if you don't fit into this type of audience... The artwork is fine, gameplay is very organic and it has a easy playability. Experts may race through this game in a couple of hours - if you want to get all achievements you might to have take your time. 

Those type of games are games without consequences (at least quite often if you do it all right), there will be only [b]one[/b] Ending ... a happy end. [i]Sighs[/i] I am a grimm type of person, so I often like to mess up all the glamour, the beauty and the pretenses... so, yeah, no luck for me today. Games that have a hundred or more ways to mess up things, or to send the protagonists of a story into impeeding doom... yeah, that is where I do excell. And probably you also will miss the shocking effects of the protagonist falling into the deep abyss, chained to a cannon. Well, never mind. The game is still fun to play, and very much so. It is type of eye candy that makes your eyes get stuck onto the screen, till you have squeezed even the last drop of dour enjoyment out of this game.

7,99 Euros is a little bit too high as price for this game though, but still - if you like these genre, buy a copy of it and enjoy it in a dark, unlit room... But don't be afraid too much about Davy Jones.

13096057.review:
...ist ein Wimmelbild Spiel von Artifex Mundi. 
Sehr hübsche Grafik, sehr schöne Musik und eine einfache Steuerung ermöglichen einen tollen Einstieg ins Spiel. Ich weiß nicht, wie AM es schafft, aber die Atmosphäre in jedem ihrer Spiele ist absolut stimig, so auch hier.
Die Rätsel sind nicht wirklich schwer, aber die Wimmebilder haben es absolut in sich. Sowie auch das Mahjong, an dem ich für den letzten Erfolg (2 Spiele ohne auto-Mischen) gerade ein bisschen am verzweifeln bin. 
Die Story ist toll, wenn auch überschau- und berechenbar. Es hat auf jeden Fall Spaß gemacht sie durchzuspielen.
Insgesamt brauchte ich für den ersten Durchgang 3,5 Stunden, für den zweiten nurnoch 2,3, daher kann man ablesen, dass das Spiel relativ kurz ist. Für den Preis den ich zahlte (~3,50€) war es das aber absolut wert und ich kann es nahezu vorbehaltlos an jeden Wimmelbild-Fan weiterempfehlen!
AM Spiele haben ich bisher voll überzeugt!

13091148.review:
以前在电脑上玩过很多国内汉化的点击型AVG冒险游戏，此类游戏的数量是巨大的，而每个游戏时间一般在3-5小时左右，无需复杂的动作，升级，策略，找一个阳光的下午，冲上一杯茶或者咖啡，只要右手点击鼠标就够了，慢慢体会一次美妙的冒险。
本作算是同类游戏中的佳作。从没想到在STEAM上还有这种游戏并且带官方汉化，仅此一点就值得购买了。点击型AVG已经形成固定的套路，无非就是几个热门的题材如鬼魂，吸血鬼，破案等，然后必定会出现看词找物的谜题，其他如拼图，齿轮构造，数字计算，颜色搭配等。你可以想象成去掉全部战斗的生化危机。以上描述就是比较主流的点击AVG游戏套路，游戏好坏就好看美工如何，故事如何，以及谜题巧妙度如何了。该作也没有例外，海盗的题材算是少有，有很多电影[加勒比海盗]的影子。故事不是特别引人入胜，属于此类的平均水平。谜题困难度普通适合大众。美工中上水准，还算精美，过场里有类似CG动画式的表现。
最后成就方面，这一类应该都算成就神作了吧，一般也都自带攻略详解，2周目即可全成就了。
等全成就本作后，我会考虑购买其他带中文的作品，有中文就是好！

13064808.review:
Got this on a coupon.
A decent point-and-click. Most of the puzzles are hidden object or mahjong, but there are a few other scenarios to break up that monotony. The thing about this game that makes it odd is that has a lack of challenge, both good and bad. There is no good challenge in the sense that you are told exactly where to go and when, and there is really no way to lose. I'm playing this to have a spooky pirate skellingtons adventure, not "Gone Home: Pirates Edition".
There is no bad challenge in the sense that every action taken in the game is logical, and there isn't a whole lot of guesswork. In other games of this genre, I might, due to an obscure objective, just do random stuff until I find something that works. Thank goodness that is not the case here.
The art style is fine, but it quickly becomes obvious that almost everything is a 2D image. It's really noticeable during the dialogue sequences. The dialogue... works. It's certainly not the best, but it does its job in telling the story.
If you really like point-and-click games, and this is on discount, or you have a coupon, you might want to pick it up. It's not particularly innovative, but it's still a neat little diversion that will last a few hours.

12994803.review:
[h1]Short version: 81%[/h1]
Nightmares From the Deep: The Cursed Heart is a nicely drawn, although somewhat easy hidden object puzzle game with an engaging pirate-themed ghost story. 

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
As most hidden object puzzle games, Nightmares From the Deep: The Cursed Heart features truly astounding hand-drawn graphics, although they are maybe a bit too fairytale-ish for a game that takes places on a ghost ship and a haunted island.

The story dares to venture away from the usual ‘bad unknown evil cursed the magical land’ formula; our main lead, a museum curator, involuntarily gets wrapped up in a bittersweet pirate ghost tale of two lovers torn apart by fate. The narration and the voice acting are clunky, and the daughter character has the annoying damsel in distress syndrome, but the plot and some of the dialogues really make up for these shortcomings.

The puzzles, including the hidden object scenes, are somewhat on the easy side, but they offer a nice variety to keep the game constantly interesting and fun to play. And frankly, nobody should expect more from a one-afternoon long, nice and relaxing game like this one.

12920269.review:
Another nice little game to basically use as a relaxation agent. Artifex Mundi makes pretty solid games overall, nothing special but not bad either.

The most notable thing I enjoyed about this one was the sonar that aids you minorly in hidden object scenes, I found it helpful without ruining the puzzles or anything. I also prefer Mahjong over dominoes as the alternate game. The game map could serve to be a bit better though, about 70% of the screens are one long line with a few rooms/paths branching off, and it can be a pain to navigate, especially near endgame. 

The story takes elements from Pirates of the Carribean, rather heavily, up to having a heart in a chest keeping an otherwise immortal pirate king alive. I get the impression that Artifex Mundi just takes ideas from other places and uses them as their story, but whatever the story is not very important here anyways.

Overall, a solid game, maybe not worth the full price but certainly worth checking out on sale.

12812229.review:
Largely paralleling Disney's Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest, Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart is a hidden object game (HOG) that compensates its lack of substance and numerous narrative issues with excellent production values and a continuation of Artifex Mundi's proven casual adventure game formula.

The consistent poor delivery of a story so full of tone and logical issues is by far the worst aspect of the experience. Though I wouldn't say I expect much from games of the genre, The Cursed Heart was an unexpected low for a developer that I know to be better than what they showcased here. It's shallow, abysmally voiced, and weighs down an otherwise mostly enjoyable game. It's hovers right between ignorable and so-bad-it's-good, but winds up more obnoxiously persistent than anything else.

A slightly awkward world to navigate combined with the often unclear objectives were also a bit annoying, in the sense that I had to continually check my map for where to go as opposed to a more natural form of progression. Despite these issues I would still consider The Cursed Heart worth checking out if you've exhausted the rest of the developer's catalog. Its high production values and addicting game design (the reason for which I'm still trying to figure out) are as exceptional as ever, it's mainly the developer's pedigree which brings the experience down, having demonstrated a better knack than most for the genre and in doing so set a higher standard which they as are also going to be judged against.

12811168.review:
这是通关的第六个steam游戏了。
游戏类型跟9clue一样，是指指点点的解谜游戏。画面可以说相当的精美，这类游戏么必须有这个优点撒。找东西的场景有个特点，允许你玩麻将连连看来代替找东西的场景，而且也有相应的成就，这样要想全成就的同学必须玩起码两遍了O(∩_∩)O~
剧情比较直白，作为博物馆馆长的母亲一天晚上收到个文物，结果打开来一看是个活死人船长雷明顿，并且掳走了女儿，召唤来一艘幽灵船准备扬长而去。这母亲为了救女儿也满拼的，上了贼船就跟着去了。好在船上那些死鬼水手倒也没有恶意，船长专注于自己的大业也无暇他顾。于是一路解完了船上的谜题，船也到了骷髅岛。
这是海盗们从前的老巢，现在已是一座鬼屋。当年船长爱上了抢来的女伯爵，女伯爵也是斯德哥尔摩附身，就此举行婚礼。但是女伯爵的爹没这么玛丽苏啊，玩一招阳奉阴违，假意答应结婚，在婚礼现场大开杀戒，咔嚓了所有海盗，还把女儿嫁给了剿匪有功的手下船长。但是雷明顿船长好死不死的跟斯派洛船长的老相识戴维琼斯有过一腿，好吧是有过交易，结果装进棺材被沉入海底却没法死。直到被打捞出来。 然后雷明顿也不知道从哪里学了啥招魂术，要把爱人复活，当然这种邪术需要一个祭品，就是主角的女儿了。
说来这女伯爵倒也是真爱，嫁人了之后郁郁寡欢，之后就搬到骷髅岛上住，死了也指定要埋在这里。岛上的谜题也是一大堆，解到后来，这女伯爵算是深明大义，不愿复活，反而要求主角找齐金币，解除船长的诅咒，两人地府想见，然后劝服了船长，救回了女儿，算是大团圆结局。
这种游戏自带中文真是很好评，拿到的物品明白是什么了也就知道在什么地方使用了，根本不用提示和攻略。dlc的内容也满充实的，讲离开岛后，因为没有地图，误打误撞开到另外个小岛，解除了另外个水手的诅咒，然后安全回家的故事。长度大概有本体1/3呢，很厚道，还有动画，壁纸等可以看。

PROS:
 - Nice art style, very "piratey"
 - Good music
 - A few challenging puzzles

CONS:
 - VERY repetitive minigames
 - Horrible voice-acting and dialogue
 - Extremely easy to progress and figure out where to go, borders on grotesque

It really pains me to not give this game a thumbs up. Largely, I think my disappointment came from expecting a challenge.
Finished in just about 5 hours, I only really got stuck 2 times, for about 10 minutes each. This "adventure" game guides your hand so much that it's more like an on-rail adventure. Every single time you find a new object, the game basically tells you exactly where to go next, and what to do. And the mindless "find 10 items" minigames... ugh.

12662648.review:
Spielwertung: 10/10

Mal wieder ein Spiel von Artifex Mundi. Im Prinzip hat sich seit "Abyss", das ich vor ein paar Tagen durchgespielt habe, nicht sehr viel geändert, daher nur die Kurzfassung:

- tolle Graphik (wenn auch keine A-Liga, aber schöner, weicher Comicstil)
- tolle Musik (nichts Besonderes)
- ganz gute Vertonung auf Englisch, auch nix Spektakuläres
- nette Rätsel, allerdings sind mir hier doch einige Dinge aufgefallen. Bei AM scheint man sich gerne mal "alter" Rätsel zu bedienen, einige kamen fast 1:1 in "Abyss" schon vor. Ich schätze, das wird mir bei AM Spielen noch häufiger auffallen. Andererseits gab es auch ein paar Neue. 
- die Wimmelbildszenen waren überaus machbar, nur 1-2 war es wirklich schwer, vor allem, wenn man konsequent auf Hilfe verzichtet. Abyss war schwerer. 
- im Unterschied zu Abyss gab es als Alternative Majongg statt Domino, was tendenziell schwerer war, aber dennoch nicht zu verlieren und auch lustiger als Domino. 
- die Story nimmt sich wieder viele Parallelen aus anderen Romanen, Spielen und Filmen. Dennoch hat sie auch ihren eigenen Flow. Auf jeden Fall keine Enttäuschung. 
- Steuerung ist ohnehin flüssig wie eh und je. 

Gefreut hat mich das Erfolgssystem. Alles hat diesmal bugfrei geklappt im 1. try. Ich weiß nicht ob es gewollt war, aber selbst auf Expert waren die Wimmelbildszenen markiert. Das Spiel hat im 1. Run auf Expert ca. 5 Stunden gedauert. Will man alle Erfolge haben, muss man mindestens ein 2. Spiel durchspielen, das geht dann aber auch auf "Normal" und dauert ca. die Hälfte. Aber auch das hat gut geklappt und ein 2. Mal dieses Spiel durchhuschen ist zwar dennoch ein bisschen "Gängelung", schadet aber auch nicht. Am Ende konnte ich also nach knapp 8 Stunden ein perfektes Spiel mehr abschließen. Wer einfach nur "spielen will": Für 1-2 Abende perfekte Rätselunterhaltung. Deswegen auch, gerade im Hinblick auf den Erfolgsärger bei "Abyss", diesmal die perfekte Wertung von mir!

12493063.review:
Nightmares from the Deep: The cursed heard is a casual point & click game. I'm going to be very brief because there isn't much to say about a point & click game. Usually the only thing that changes is the art and the story.

This game took me 3-4h to beat without the help of any walkthroughs. The puzzles are very unique and fun to do (the final urn puzzle is a bit "challenging" for the casual player and it took me a while to do it) and the art is also pretty.

The story kinda reminds me of pirates of the caribbean (mainly at the end because of the heart scene) but that's probably a coincidence.

TL;DR : Game is worth playing if you love point & click games. However there aren't any unique features besides the puzzles and story.

12485029.review:
One of the best hidden object games I've played so far. It has a solid story, solid game play and the voice acting is actually decent. I guess my only issue is that the extra storyline was short, but it was still nice and answered a question that was lingering after the end of the game.

If you're into this genre of games then you'll probably like this one. It has a fair amount of hidden object scenes mixed with other types of puzzles. There is also a helpful map which clues you in on which area to go to next so you can keep progressing. Though some hidden object scenes get revisted and they're not as challenging the second time around.

Story is rather straight forward and doesn't have that many twists and turns, you can figure it out pretty quickly. But it's still told well and who doesn't like pirates?!

Long story short, buy the game.

12472680.review:
