12430206.review: 各方面表现都还不错的解谜游戏，剧情有些亮点，就是过场动画还比较生硬，在几个寻物场景里物品的翻译有点问题，让人摸不着头脑。

12386830.review:
通关了，好像玩了11个小时还是12个小时来着，玩这类型游戏这估计是很少见像我一样玩这么长时间的吧？
整整玩了四个存档啊，实际我玩了五遍，有两遍是玩了一下开头就关了的，另外三遍是全程都通关了的。主要是为了拿全成就。

暂且回归正题。
这是一款很不错的冒险解谜类游戏，剧情方面也可以算得上中上水平吧，音乐也很不错，至少我在多周目的时候还没厌恶（也可能是为了成就而忽略了这点）。

如果是经常玩冒险解谜类的朋友一定不要错过哦（我才不会说因为原先是猛犸汉化组的忠粉后来看见黑桐谷歌实况后知道了steam这个正版平台就直接入坑了呢）

好吧接下来要来批评一下这个游戏的不足之处了。
首先是翻译的问题，当然了有中文简直是良心至极啊，放心吧该游戏厂商发布在steam上的这类游戏全部加入愿望单里打算剁手月里买买买了，不过其中还是有些翻译是有点问题的，如果我的游戏流程正确的话，在做完可以溶解铁链的试剂之后有一个找东西的场景中有一个扑克牌的【梅花】被错误翻译为【狼牙棒】了；还有就是在接近结局的时候会进入油画后面的房间中，点击骨灰瓮所触发的事件记录在笔记本中的内容似乎是主游戏结束以后的附赠游戏中的内容，当然了或许只是我理解错误了，但是在那个骨灰瓮存在的房间里的灵魂不是女伯爵而是戴维·琼斯？可是笔记本的内容写的似乎是附赠游戏中后来那个无辜船长的事？

另外一个不足之处就是游戏成就，要完成所有的寻物游戏的成就以及完成所有麻将游戏的成就分明就是想要玩家玩二周目啊，因为要拿到其中一项成就就必须从头到尾只用寻物或是麻将模式过关才行，我第一周目因为不知道这件事导致不仅玩了麻将还玩了寻物模式，导致两个成就都无法拿到其中的一个，然后我就果断重开了第二和第三周目全部通关（前两次的完全通关），但我发现要得到最后的那个拿齐其他成就才能得到的全称就并不会因为分开存档拿而会自动获取，而是要就着原先已经通关过的存档再重新玩一遍把剩余的成就拿完才会得到，所以我第二天又果断地通了第三遍。（总觉得没拿到全成就就等于没玩完这款游戏，也就没什么心思再玩其他游戏了，绝对不是强迫症而是有点完美主义而已。）

还有要提醒想要拿到专家模式的成就，就必须通关附赠游戏的内容才会获得。

好像自从steam推出了音乐之后这个游戏也有音乐可听了（我是在游戏中打开社区看见了的，音乐应该不错）

啊对了，游戏里面有活着的尸体哦，虽然不会死啦但是如果比较胆小的话还是建议白天玩。


一个游戏被我玩了这么多遍、一篇测评被我修改了三遍我也真服了自己，我绝逼是这类游戏的脑残粉。

以上。

12338961.review:
Picked up Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart during a sale. This was my first Hidden Object Game, didn't even knew this sort of games existed. :)
You play a female museum curator whose daughter is kidnapped by an undead pirate. Quickly you find yourself in hot pursuit to set her free. The game is the first part of a trilogy.
While I didn't have high hopes for this game, I quickly found myself hooked on progressing through the game. The main game is a point & click adventure, but combined with 3 types of sub-games. First there are puzzles, which are usually not too difficult to solve. Second there are the hidden object games, where you need to find a list of objects in a single scene. And third, mahjong. Mahjong? Rather strange, as Caribbean piracy was already stopped by the time this Chinese tile game was created...
I found the game addictive as you quickly pass puzzle by puzzle and the story line opens up. Not a must-play game, but quite entertaining.

Score: 7/10

Pro: 
+ nice graphics
+ steady game progress
+ decent story
+ additional bonus story

Contra:
- maybe a bit too short?

12249104.review:
Hippasta piraatin kanssa.



Museon väki on innoissaan. Vuosien etsimisen jälkeen pahamaineisen merirosvo Remingtonin ruumis on löytynyt, joten ainut järkevä teko on laittaa tämä ruumis näytille. Kun tytär jää ihmettelemään mitä voisi tehdä, on sinun tehtävänäsi avata laatikko ja muutaman somistelun jälkeen päästää paha valloilleen. Remington varastaa tyttäresi ja sinun on lähdettävä pelastamaan häntä tyhjästä ilmestyvälle merirosvolaivalle. Juoni ei paljoa tästä syvene, mutta koska merirosvoja.



Peli sisältää jotain uutta ja jotain vanhaa. Pelimekaniikka on tuttua sattumanvaraisten esineiden etsimistä ruuduista ja maailmasta yleensä. Vaihteen vuoksi etsintäruuduissakin joutuu availemaan laatikoita tai käyttämään esineitä toisiinsa, jotta saa vaikka kuoritun omenan. Tavaroita käytetään kumminkin loogisesti, vaikka niiden löytymispaikat eivät noudata mitään logiikkaa. Esineitä ei tarvitse yhdistellä valikossa, vaan mahdollinen yhdistely tehdään ruudulla.



Poiketen esim. Sherlock Holmesin seikkailuista, ei tässä tule näkyviin milloin paikka on käyty kokonaan läpi. Tämä on erittäin turhauttavaa, sillä pelissä on aivan älyttömästi kulkemista edes takaisin yhden esineen vuoksi. Koska etsintäruutuja on useita ja vieläpä samassa huoneessa, onnistuu ne hienoisesta kiillostaan huolimatta ohittamaan. Edes takaisen liikkuminen paikkojen välillä aiheuttaa sitä, että yksinkertaisesti unohtaa mahdolliset paikat.



Pelin välivideot ovat ontuvia ja muovisia. Suurin osa tarinasta selitetään arkunvartijan toimesta, mutta nämäkään animaatiot eivät ole mistään parhaasta päästä. Keskustelut tapahtuvat ajoittain suoraan pelimoottorilla tehtynä, jolloin puhe ja huulisynkka ovat valovuosien päässä toisistaan. Mitä tulee itse suuriin välivideoihin, nämä ovat täyttä kuraa. En usko, että edes YouTuben alhaisin videolaatu on yhtä huono kuin välivideot ajoittain. Välivideot ovat lyhyitä ja olisivat mahdollisesti erittäin näyttäviä, ellei kuvanlaatu pilaisi näitä kohtauksia.



Musiikki on ajoittain erittäin kaunista ja saa jäämään vain kuuntelemaan. Tämä on tosiaan ajoittaista, sillä muuten peli on suhkot hiljainen muutamine ääniefekteineen siellä täällä. Ääninäyttely ei ole huonoa eikä hyvää, mutta samalla ei siltikkään mitään siitä väliltä. Dialogia on kumminkin sopivan vähän, joten asiaan ei tule liikaa kiinnitettyä huomiota. Mutta kuten välivideoissa, on laaduntarkkailu jäänyt tekemättä myös audion puolella. Osa keskusteluista on lähes kuuntelukelvottomia, sillä puheen laatu on erittäin rakeista ja repeilevää.




Hieman yksinkertaisempi ja suoraviivaisempi hidden object-peli, joka kumminkin onnistuu viehättämään merirosvo-teemalla sekä ajoittain näyttävillä ympäristöillä. Osa puzzleista ei selvitä itseään kunnolla, mutta vihjetoiminto on aina auttamassa. Juoni itsessään on jonkinlainen yhdistelmä Monkey Islandia sekä Pirates of the Carribeania, mutta mikäs siinä. Muutaman tunnin kestävä pelikokemus ei jätä kumminkaan huonoa makua suuhun, joten erittäin halvalla peligenrestä pitäville tämä on ihan makoisa välipala.

77 doubloonia

12005902.review: Artifex Mundi does it again... this title certainly delivers the level of quality and enjoyability that I expect from these games. With that said, I found a few exceptionally good things, and found a few things to be less enthused about. Firstly, the good: the game is beautifully illustrated, it has fantastic subject matter and setting, and it is satisfactorily full in length of gameplay. The voice acting and writing / dialogue are decent. The weaknesses are mostly that it eventually becomes slightly tedious, as clues later in the game require less intuition and more room-bypass-clicking legwork; in this regard there is a sense of the length of gameplay being somewhat inflated by unnecessary backtracking and uninspired search-errands. The puzzles are not particularly inspired either, however, some of the hidden object scenes are fairly challenging, and there were word usages and terms I was unfamiliar with (e.g. cockade) that upped the challenge bar. It is a very well-polished game, and I thoroughly enjoyed it, but I cannot help get the feeling that it somehow underachieves. Recommended: [ 7 / 10 ]

12004044.review: Another good one. Had fun playing. Puzzles might be little bit more demanding but anyway worth to play.

11985709.review: Скучная игра. Мы играем за смотрительницу музея организовавшую выставку с выловленными останками пирата, который оживает и похищает дочь героини. В игре чувствуется параллель с фильмом «Пираты Карибского моря» и тут и там пираты–призраки, разделённая любовь, осьминоги, сундук с сердцем, но если в фильме гигантский размах, огромные средства и звёздные актеры, то в игре лишь заимствование и маленький бюджет, всё выглядит как не умело рассказанная сказка. Вам предстоит блуждание туда-сюда по локациям с повторяющимися квестами из другой игры (Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden), также присутствует поиск предметов в слабо освещённых местах и тошнотворных болотистых зелёных полутонах. На выбор есть маджонг - не интересно. Заставки в игре выполнены в очень низком качестве и с низким разрешением. Музыка - одна и та же мелодия, лейтмотив таков все плохо, все умерли, жизнь закончилась. Нам дважды рассказывают одну и ту же историю, сначала из обрывков дневников, записок и бесед с призраками и говорящими скелетами, затем за каждую монетку принесённую к сундуку нам повторяют тоже самое но уже в картинках, зачем не понятно. В игре присутствует бонус, вот он чуть поинтереснее, но это игру не спасает.

11909519.review:
Usually I'm a big fan of these games but I have mixed feelings with this one. The game have some upsides and downsides so let's begin with the upsides. It has a nice story that you constantly want to know more about, good graphic if you look away from the bad animated movie clips and this game is one of the few where I think the puzzles is a bit hard. I enjoyed the voicing and the art, although - as is always the case - a couple of the objects were real "wha" moments, as in "wha zat?" (so it's a good thing the "sonar" shows outlines). 11758683.review:
This was not nearly as polished as other Artifex Mundi games, but it was still enjoyable.

The plot is reminiscent of Pirates of the Caribbean, just slightly more convoluted and tragic.  

The resolution of the artwork was somewhat blurry compared to what I am used to from this studio, which made cutscenes harder to watch, and many of the hidden object puzzles a challenge.  I found myself having to use the sonar feature fairly often because I couldn't distinguish one object from another, although it was never so bad that I had to use a hint.  I honestly preferred playing the mahjong.  The background locations were pretty, though.  

The point-and-click puzzles were mostly logical, although there was a lot of backtracking for what felt like very little payoff.  Also, I really hope you like collecting ingredients for recipes.

The voice acting and music were decent, and there was even a bit of humor with the pirates on the ship.

I was slightly disappointed with the bonus mission.  While the puzzles were pretty good, the spelling, grammar, and word choices were terrible: "tukan" instead of "toucan," "perl" instead of "pearl," "wires" instead of "yarn with knitting needles"... it just got worse and worse.  I can overlook small mistakes, especially in bonus content, but some of the errors made finishing the hidden object games nearly impossible without resorting to sonar or hints.

Overall, it is a decent little game.  It has its shortcomings, but it was relaxing enough and interesting enough to occupy an afternoon.  It took about 8 hours to beat it twice through on expert mode (once for each set of achievements) including the additional mission, so I feel like I got my sale-price money's worth.  

I would give it a 6/10.

11682093.review:
Pros:
+ Beautiful visuals and excellent mood
+ Very good UI
+ You can freely switch between HO scenes and mahjong
+ Cutscenes are nicely animated and quite smoothly blend with ingame visuals
+ Believable HO scenes with mostly relevant objects, not just random junkpiles
+ Perfect difficulty level (though this is of course subjective), I played mostly in Expert mode, switched to the easier mode just a handful of times to check which fields to visit when I ran out of ideas. Managed not to use any hints until the very end of the game, which almost never happens with me.

Cons:
- Very clichéd story. Though at least it's not a guy saving a woman, instead two strong and capable female characters have cardinal role in the story. (One is the protagonist, but the other is not the daughter - to avoid spoilers :) )
- The daughter's voice is annoying, the dub sounds very beginner
- Some cutscene animations aren't lip-synced with the dub

Overall: 9/10
Haven't seen such high quality HO/adventure game since I played Dire Grove.

EDIT: There are so many typos in the Extra adventure, seems like they didn't ran the HO word list through even a Word spell check. Come on creators, you didn't make such mistakes in the main game.

11677659.review:
La encargada de este trabajo es la desarrolladora Artifex Mundi, una pequeña empresa que desde su creación solo se ha encargado de hacer juegos similares; unos títulos que gozan en conjunto de las mismas características que podrían bien considerarse defectos, pero sin quitar que cumplen con el principio indiscutible de cualquier juego; entretener.

Los defectos de los que hablo y que logicamente tiene Nightmare form the deep son producto de los escasos medios que debe de tener la desarrolladora, así nos encontraremos con escenarios prerenderizados y tosquedad en cuanto a movimientos de personajes y escenas.

Pero bueno, al turrón. El argumento del juego es muy sencillo y simple. No nos cuenta una gran historia, pero el ambiente en el que se desenvuelve está muy bien logrado. Somos la encargada de una exposición pirata en un museo que está trabajando en los últimos detalles de la misma ayudada por nuestra hija. Entonces, el elemento más importante de la exposición, el cadáver de un bucanero, vuelve a la vida, secuestra a nuestra hija y huye en un barco fantasmal lleno de muertos. Y sí, eso huele a  Piratas del Caribe a la legua, pero al menos para mí, aún resulta una temática atractiva.

Nuestro objetivo es rescatar a nuestra hija y para ello deberemos recorrer diferentes niveles al más puro estilo Click & Point. El procedimiento siempre será el mismo, buscar objetos para utilizarlos en ciertos lugares y que a su vez nos den más objetos para abrir los accesos a los siguientes escenarios. Pero no todos los objetos los encontraremos haciendo click en la pantalla, muchos de ellos los obtendremos como resultado de resolver puzles de búsqueda de objetos o jugando al Mahjong -aunque esto no tenga nada que ver con la trama-.

Lamentablemente, si hay un elemento que ha empañado en algo la experiencia del juego es su nula dificultad. Si eres un cegato y no ves los objetos relucientes que hay que recoger, el juego te da la opción de pedir pistas infinitas para encontrarlo. ¿Dónde han quedado los desafíos de las aventuras gráficas?

Pasarnos Nightmare form the deep: The cused heart nos llevará no más de cuatro horas y media. Lo bueno es que con el propio juego nos viene una pequeña expansión del mismo que nos depara otros 40 minutos más de entretenimiento. Sin duda es un juego que yo no dejaría escapar en un bundle o en alguna oferta que lo ponga por debajo de los 3 €uros.

11408456.review:
For the type of game that it is, Nightmares from the Deep has more quality than i expected. Entertaining story, decent animation, and interesting environments. The game mixes point-and-click adventure with hidden object as well as a few mini-games sprinkled in. The puzzles are clever but not overly challenging. I never needed to use the "Hint" button.

Adding to the list of positive things are steam achievements, trading cards, a nice music score and zombie pirates.

If I have any negative marks against the game, it is a little on the short side. There is a bonus adventure that allows you to continue where the main game ended, but it too is short. I also wish the protagonist's daughter had a name. I don't feel as invested when I think of "HOLD ON! I'LL SAVE YOU.....WHATEVER YOUR NAME IS!". Maybe I'm supposed to be a crappy parent who can't remember my kids name.

Overall, it's enjoyable and if you feel the price is too high, wait for a Steam sale.

11147643.review:
I had a huge addiction for these hidden object style casual adventure games a few years ago until I totally burned out on them.
This game was my first, tentative, step back into the genre. And a good one at that. It's not the deepest game you'll ever play (no pun intended), but it entertained me enough to play it through to its satisfying conclusion.

Gameplay consists of traversing (pretty much) static screens of a museum, a pirate ship and a mysterious island, gathering items and solving decently fun puzzles. Items are generally gained by playing a mini-game, which is either the traditional hidden object one [b]OR[/b] a game of Mahjong. The critical detail here is that you can choose which one to play whenever you want!
I went through the game only solving the Mahjong puzzles and had a great time.

The game is a great introduction to the genre and a solid example of how to do a casual adventure game right.
Steer clear of it if you're looking for a particularly serious or challenging experience though.

Au final, ce point-and-click se laisse savourer et permet de divertir l'espace de quelques heures. Pourquoi ne pas essayer...?


L'affreux

Got this in a bundle and played it for the cards, but I must say, if you are into hidden item/Myst-style games, this is a very good game to get. For the price, I think you will get a reasonable amount of play time in.

The artwork is appealing and the Pirate Zombie theme is great if you like that. Puzzles are not too challenging, and there is definitely a lot of backtracking throughout the map. The skip functionality doubles as a hint tracker that recharges, ensuring that you wont be stuck for too long.

There is also a find-the-items minigame (among all the other minigames) and you can play mahjong as an alternative and I thought that was really nice.

The story is meh, nothing too special, but for the price I would personally wait for it to go down before purchasing (but I am also very frugal lol)

11090569.review:
It's really hard to make good Point&Click Adventure game nowadays. But this piece manage to do that. But let's start from the beginning.

I had mixed feelings about this. I finished Mystery of Montlake Mansion few months earlier, and this game is almost like a clone to the latter. But hell, it's Steam Sale, so whatever. 

At the beginning everything is just like the forementioned title. The graphics is kind of corky, and sometimes you just see, as if the entire game was done in Photoshop, but it's not really annoying. I must say, that I really like this kind of art style. It gives me good vibe, just like in the old pointers (Dracula and so on). It's not the best, but it's manageable. Cutscenes, on the other hand, are ugly and badly rendered. In standard games cutscenes are way better than the actual graphics of the game, right? Here's the opposite.

The music and sound is mediocre sadly. There's a sound for picking shit up, for solving shit up and for scaring (yea, right) shit outta the players. Music is really forgetable, TBH I don't remember any loop from the game itself. And I'm not sure if this is because it's so bad or there is just none.  Oh well, at least voice acting is good, right? No, it's not. It's really bad. Almost all characters in the game sound unnatural and overacting is really common. Except for maybe two undead pirates. That's kind of sad.

Gameplay is just like forementioned Mystery of Montlake. We walk around, collect crap, sometimes solve really easy puzzles or search for stuff in the clusterfucks. Modern pointer people! The olny change from the Mystery is the "ability" to change search scenes into the mahjong, which kind of speeds the game a little bit. Nevertheless, it's not something groundbreaking. On the other hand, the game is from the dead genre. And TBH even thou I kind of knew, what's coming, I couldn't stop playing it. And that's a good thing, because I can be really picky about games. 

Overally, the game is mediocre, but with the lean on the good side. It's corky and stupid, but fun to play. And it can be perfected (all achievements) in two playthou's: one with doing all search scenes normally, and the second time doing mahjong. For perfection hoarders or people new to games, I would recommend it. If you have a mother, father or little sibling, who like playing video games, and ultra violent and hard whatever is not their kind of thing, Nightmares is the perfect choice. For skilled player it's for two nights tops, and one should consider if s/he really wants to buy this piece especially when one is not a completionist. For me, I recommend it. Just for the sake of old good point&clicks. Maybe someday something good will pop up on the market.

Zawisza out.

Despite the fact that the story seems rather um...unoriginal, its still a decent story.  And I like the way the game tells the story.  It almost felt like there is only one theme song playing over and over again, but good thing is a theme that I actually like.

What I love the most about this game is that during those hidden objects puzzles, you have an option play a game of solitaire mahjong instead of the usual clicking randomly on the screen looking for hidden objects.   And I personally chose to play these mahjong solitaire game every time.  The rest of the puzzles are rather easy, I probably haven't really skipped a puzzle.  If you like challenging puzzles, this probably isn't the kind of game for you.

Just make sure you play the bonus mode, it adds another hour of gameplay.  Overall, not bad of a casual hidden object game.

Квест про мертвых пиратов.

Завязка такова - одна очень умная женщина (владелица тематического музея) решила устроить выставку на тему пиратов. Ну и недолго думая включила в состав произведений не много, ни мало труп известного пирата. А трупчик-то с гнильцой, проклятый он был. И дочку её (хозяйки музея) похитил. Такие дела. Геймплей обычный "найди предмет и вставь его куда нужно", т.е. бл*дский пиксельхантинг. Особых открытий не ждите от игры, просто сменяются локации-фоны и мы начинаем поиск вновь и вновь. Иногда попадаются миниигры, но особой роли это не играет. Просто обычный квест, коих тысячи, ничем особым не выделяющийся.

Найди пирата! 5,5 из 10 :)

Nightmares from the Deep è un'avventura punta e clicca hidden objects ad ambientazione piratesca.
L'avventura principale è di breve durata, in 5/6 ore la finite tranquillamente; va ad aggiungersi una mini avventura (che troverete nella sezione extra del menù) che è il continuo di quella principale.
Negli extra potrete trovare anche i concept art e avrete la possibilità di rigiocare i minigiochi.

Per quanto mi riguarda è stato piacevole giocarci; la storia è semplice (non spicca particolarmente per originalità) e gli enigmi non troppo difficili.
Se siete amanti del genere ne vale la pena, ancora meglio se riuscite a trovarlo in bundle!

10217098.review: Se cercate un gioco leggero che unisce le situazioni da avventure punta e clicca con quelle "trova oggetto nascosto", questo Nightmares from the Deep non vi deluderà. La storia ha una sola soluzione e non ho mai trovato serie difficoltà a proseguire i vari enigmi, nemmeno i puzzle più difficili. In alcuni schermi alcune traduzioni in italiano sono totalmente fuorvianti: è il caso di una spazzola divenuta pennello e di un dado bianco da gioco divenuto tintura bianca per viso. A parte queste "piccolezze" si riesce a giocare senza difficoltà e consiglio fin da subito la modalità esperto, in quanto la modalità principiante vi propone sempre cosa guardare ed esplorare togliendovi parte del gusto dell'esplorazione. Se non vi piacciono gli schermi con i puzzle o trova l'oggetto in alternativa vi propongono delle sfide a majhong. Il gioco non è lunghissimo, ma nella sezione extra è presente il proseguo dell'avventura per qualche altra ora di gioco. La grafica è fatta molto bene, le animazioni anche peccato che non siano ad alta definizione, forse per un roblemi di fluidità. Lo consiglio a tutti gli amanti di questo genere di giochi, leggeri, non troppo impegnativi e con un buon rapporto qualità prezzo.

Простота - вообще одна из ключевых фишек игры, все проходится на расслабоне. Завершив все доступные приключения я могу сказать, что игра действительно обладает каким-то неуловимим удовольствием.

9967661.review:
This game is strangely compelling for a casual adventure game that focuses heavily on hidden object puzzles.  The difficulty 
isn't really there - you'll breeze past this game, even on expert mode (and really, you need to play this on expert mode for this to be even remotely challenging).

That being said, despite most of my time being put into roguelikes or twitchfests these days, I found this to be a great way to spend an afternoon as I downed tremendous amounts of coffee (typically how I like to spend Sundays).  Like I said, the difficulty is hardly anything to shake a stick at, but the game is pretty good at providing feedback loop to the player to always make it feel like you're making progress.  The story is somewhat of a joke, but I can safely say that the 12-year-old me would have probably loved this game to death.  The guy over twice his age... you know what? I liked it for what it was.

One caveat, however, is if you're going to 100% the game (which I did, so that's saying something, right?) you might not enjoy a second trip around as you'll need to play the game twice to get every cheevo.  Normally I don't do this, but it was too easy to pass up.  So why is playing it twice so bad?

The game offers an alternative most of its hidden object puzzles (there are secondary HOGs to play that make absolutely no effort to hide anything; they are thematic bits to vary up the found-something-in-the-pile method of providing the player items) in the form of "Mahjong".  First off, I hate that anyone calls the matching game of mahjong tiles "Mahjong".  It's Shanghai, and Shanghai sucks!  If the game had real mahjong, I'd probably enjoy it a lot more (and no way that's going to happen).  However, if HOGs aren't your thing, but you would prefer to match tiles to pass puzzles, you're welcome to do that.  And you can't possibly fail, either as getting to a stalemate simply reshuffles the stack... which will affect your achievement hunt.

So, in conclusion:
- Great time waster with some interesting if not terribly difficult puzzles
- "Mahjong" tile matching will shrivel your sack and must be suffered if you want to 100% the game
- Recommended, but you might want to hunt for it in a bundle. It is not worth the price of admission, even with the extra scenario packed in for "collectors"
- Alternatively, get it elsewhere (cheevos are also in-game and just as useful off of Steam as they are on it) for much less.

9966451.review:
¸.•*¨).•´¸.•*¨) Nightmares From The Deep ¸.•*¨).•´¸.•*¨)
(¸.•´ (¸.*´ ¸.•´(¸.•´ The Cursed Heart ¸.•´ (¸.*´ ¸.•´ (¸.*´

~Overview~
STORY: 3/5
DIFFICULTY: 1/5
GAMEPLAY: 3/5
GRAPHIC: 2/5
REPLAYABILITY: 2/5

~My Personal Progress~
Story: 300% [beat the game three times, in regular and expert mode]
Time played: 10h05m total [3h55m 1st run (regular) + 3h15m 2nd run (expert, mahjong achievement) + 2h55m 3rd run (expert, hidden object achievement)]
Achievements: 100% [15/15 ACMs]

~Review~
"Nightmares From The Deep: The Cursed Heart" is a simple hidden-object-/puzzle-game set in a mystic "cursed Pirate"-Adventure.
The story is simple and straight forward: you're a museum's curator and proud mother. You receive the dead body of  Captain Remington, who was - back then in his days - a feared and cruel pirate. In fact, you are the one who brings him back to life and Remington flees with your daughter to Skull Island. Obviously, it is your task to rescue your duaghter and break the curse that keeps the old Captain alive. One should not expect a deep and emotionally moving story behind such a game and so didn't I, to be honest. That's simply because such games are ment to be played casually: easy to learn, even easier to master! In comparison to other games of this genre this game made a quite good attempt and at least tries to build up tension and most of the time keeps you a little curious, indeed. Of course, this isn't comparable to extraordinary RPGs, for example, but within its own genre this game knows how to sell its plot well (therefore my STORY-rating is pushed from a 2 to a 3).
The difficulty was mainly rated with the highest difficulty-level in mind. There are two modes you can choose from: "regular mode" that shows on your maps all places where actions are available and gives you a shorter charge time for hints, and "expert mode" that doesn't give you hints at all and lets your hint-bar fill up more slowly. If you play this game for the first time, expert mode can be really hard, indeed, because you have to spent more attention on clickable items and have to backtrack a lot to find spawning hidden-object-scenes, but there is one big downside: the game offers a complete "strategy guide" ... I would rather call it a "click-through", to be honest. It's an entire list of all objectives, you have to fulfill, including all clickable items with a beautiful photo gallery. This is ... *clearing throat* ... ment to be nice, really, but this game is simple enough and offering a complete walk-through is destroying the last bit of a challenge completely ^^" Without this "feature" my rating would probably have been a 3 of 5 due to the expert mode, but in this case I decided to reduce it to a 1 out of 5 because even the [i]"clever puzzles"[/i] (as stated in the game description) weren't clever enough in my opinion but rather easy-peasy.
The gameplay is solid and the voice acting is ok. This game is actually just a simplified Point&Click-Adventure (because the game chooses the appropiate interaction-method with objects automatically, e.g. "talking" while hovering about persons, magnifying things that can be inspected, and collected objects from your inventory aren't combinable, at all) with hidden-object-/mahjong-elements and - let's be honest - it's hard to screw something up that's as simple as clicking ; ) Autosaving works perfectly fine and I didn't bump into bugs or crashes of any kind. However, there doesn't seem to be a way of starting a new game as long as your current campaign isn't finished, despite of creating a whole new player-profile; not the end of the world, but mildly annoying. Due to some restrictions I had to play this game three times to earn all achievements. Mini-games can be played in two different modes: One is the common hidden-object scene and the other one let's you solve the object finding by playing mahjong. To earn the achievements "Self-guided Tour" and "Mahjong Master And Commander" you have to solve all 28 mini-games in a playthrough either only as hidden-object-puzzles or only mahjong-challenges, and during my first run I tried out both mechanics and wasn't able to complete these puzzles a second time in the other mode. I'm not sure if this was intended. If it was, then I've got to criticize that this design-decision artificially lengthens the game time for those who want to get a Perfect Game.
The graphics are generally good and offer a decent resolution, the only thing that disappointed me, was that the game description claims to have [i]"AAA-quality cinematics"[/i] that it clearly doesn't have! The cinematics didn't scale with the resolution and because I play with a FullHD-monitor, probably as most players these days, I had to watch horribly pixelated cutscenes. Either the devs didn't test the quality on a common monitor or they simply lied ... no matter what applies, it's awefully negative, in my opinion.
I decided to decrease the rating for the game's replayability, although I personally played it three times. The reason simply is, that on one hand I only would have needed two playthroughs - maximum -, if I had paid a little bit more attention. And on the other hand I want to evaluate games as objectively as I can, which means, that I have to be aware of people that don't care for achievements like  I do. These people would probably not consider to replay this game, because it doesn't offer new challenges, alternative endings or anything else that makes this game worth playing again.

~Conclusion~
"Nightmares From The Deep" is a decent game. Those of you who like hidden-object-games will probably have some nice hours to spend with this. I personally don't think that it offers any original ideas or breakthroughs in this genre and didn't create tension or fun above the ordinary, but on the other hand I don't see any severe reason to prevent you from buying this game, if that is the kinda game you like and enjoy, because despite the misinformation about the "AAA-cinematics" it offers a solid quality and I consider it as one of the better hidden-object-games on the market.

9784921.review:
I bought Nightmares from the Deep expecting adventure game like Secret of Monkey Island et al. It turned out to be more of an interactive story intervened with puzzles. It was a bit awkward at first, but once I got used to it, I must say I quite enjoyed the game. The story might not be very original, but it's coherent and captivating. The puzzles mostly consist of "find hidden object" scenes, but there are also some more demanding ones. Though I wouldn't mind if there were more of those. Overall it's a good game and I can easily recommend it. 

The only major flaw is that you cannot get all achievements in one run, because you can either solve "find hidden object" scenes OR mahjong puzzles, not both at the same time - and there are separate achievements for each of those. So while the game has little if any replay value, you'll be forced to play it twice if you're a completionist.

Już z tego powodu warto sięgnąć po ten tytuł. Pięknie malowane tła w upiornej stylistyce, miła dla ucha muzyka oraz przyzwoite zagadki to główne zalety tej produkcji. Сцены поиска предметов очень логичны, то есть нет, к примеру, лопат больше по размеру, чем иголок. За все прохождение заметил две ошибки перевода в сценах поиска, но это особо не критично, понять, что от вас требуется легко. Для получения всех ачивок нужно два прохождения и отключайте сразу обучение, потому как первая сцена поиска не засчитается из-за того, что будут учить играть в маджонг. 9331622.review:
Do you like puzzles? Pirates? Mahjong? Short but interesting story lines? Good graphics? Point and click games? If yes to all or most of those questions then this game may be for you. 

It offers a variety of puzzles throughout the gameplay but tends to focus mostly on hidden object puzzles which can be turned into Mahjong if you prefer. Decent story line that remains interesting yet simple to follow and is enhanced by good graphics and decent voice acting. 

Story line - You are a curator at a museum and you're setting up a big exhibition with the help of your daughter. After a few 'unfortunate events' at the museum your daughter is whisked away to Skull Island and being held prisoner by an undead pirate captain. Can you complete the puzzles and save your daughter? And what would the captain want your daughter for anyway?

I experienced no glitches or errors of any kind and if I got stuck on a puzzle there is a help button to speed things along. 

My total gameplay was around 6 hours which included completion of the main story and also of the dlc. Great if you're inbetween games at the moment and want something to pass the time with or if you have just one day off school/work and want to complete something.

9317790.review:
Pretty standard point and click fare and a fairly pleasant experience that's more suitable for kids, despite the truely woeful voice acting and run-of-the mill storyline.  

The static visuals, transitions and bits of FMV are done reasonably well, with only the animations letting the side down in the graphics department.  Controls are fine and make for a smooth experience when running around the various scenes.  The game also has various mini-games within the main game, amounting to search and logic puzzles and a mahjong alternative if you don't feel like doing the search tasks.  There's nothing that will tax you too much.

It's an easy recommend, though the game does leave you with lots of unanswered questions, such as "What's wrong with subtitles?", "Why do all pirates sound like they're trying to be Australian?" and "Where's the voice volume setting?".

Recommended.
Not awesome but a good game.
Mix of adventure, puzzleing and find-the-object game, with good graphics, good story, good music and effects.
Short as a breath (7 hours main and extra adventure) but, nice to play.
Puzzles are a tad easy and, I never felt stuck. Find-the-object is a bit more tricky because translations to other languages where probably made just with one of the acceptions of an english word and, they doesn't correspond to the real name of the object in other language. You should first figure out what was the english name to try to guess what the hell do you have to search in your own language. This is the only flaw I see in this game.
If you go stuck, you can play Majhong instead and get the object or, you can just skip the mini-game and get the object.
This and the fact that puzzles are straigth-logic, save lots of frustration often fell in other point-and-click adventure games.

9230884.review:
A good hidden object/mahjong driven game with good art and a good story. The videos are a bit fuzzy at times and the voice acting sometimes spotty which is a shame cause otherwise this is a good game.

The puzzles are not difficult to figure out and the hidden object/mahjong sequences are rather good. You will most likely never get stuck on a puzzle for a long period of time. The game even has 2 playing modes: Adventure and Expert. On Adventure mode the game will show you on the map the next location you need to go to and will sparkle around objects you need to interact with whereas on Expert these helpers will not be activated,
I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys hidden object games/mahjong with a bit of adventure and good story thrown in the mix.

9213193.review:
Do you enjoy hidden object games? If so, this small Pirate Ghost themed Puzzle game hits all the right spots.

First play through, just casually going about the adventure took roughly 3 hours to hammer out, which for this type of game is just right. Not too long, and nothing too short so that your cup of tea is still warm.

[b]The story[/b] isn't anything amazing, but it is interesting enough that it sits alongside your puzzles nicely, giving just the extra little touch of interest, to keep you wanting to do 'just one more puzzle' before you have a break.

[b]Visually[/b] the game is nice, some of the cinematics are a little fuzzy, but the general look and feel of the game, is pretty pleasing to the eyes.

[b]Overall[/b], for a hidden item puzzle game, I would score [b]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart 7/10[/b].

9194166.review: This game is one of those casual hidden object games, which one can find plenty of around. The game nods continuously towards "Pirates of the Caribbean" and similar "Cursed pirate stories", which could be a plus or a minus depending on your personal preferences. It does boast rather nice background art and multiple "exotic" objects to manipulate from "all around the world". There is also a variety of ages where objects come from - modern, XVII-XVIII century and end of XIX century (if you care to go for a "bonus" adventure available under "Extras"). Some of the foreground objects look a bit cheap, though, and cutscene video quality is really way too low. While being very accessible overall (as a casual game should be) "Nightmares" does not explain everything (like "Skip by playing Mahjong" option or how to start hidden object minigames) very well in the beginning. However, there are no giant mechanical flaws in it, and the ones existing do not detract too much from the experience. Although the voice acting and overall sound assets are so-so, they do help to complete the "pirate mystery" atmoshpere. The storyline is super-simple and although it tries to add a couple of twists, overall there is nothing grasping about it. There is a little humor to be had and there are even a couple of jokes that might make you smile, but overall the game tends to overplay "serious mystery" part a little bit too much for my taste. A couple of cheap jumpscares are also available.  Having completed all of the available adventures I can say that the game does provide some casual fun for those, who appreciate the appropriate setting and do not mind to solve some simple puzzles (with ample hints available). Overall it is a good title to buy in a bundle and casually enjoy when you don't want to strain yourself or spend much time with a game. Perhaps, it could also be worth a try for HOG fans when on >75% discounts.

9053579.review:
Ok, I have become shamelessly addicted to these hidden object games. Having played three, I now consider myself an expert on them. Definitely. Anyway, this is a good one. Just don't judge it on the quality of its story and voice acting, both of which are subpar at best. It seems to be a genre convention actually, so I can go with the flow. No, these games depend more on the quality of their artwork, the level of interactivity in scenes, the quality of the puzzles (if any), and how well things sparkle and zing when you click on them. No really, when you find that hairbrush hidden carefully in the background of a scene, you want some fireworks when you click on it. It's satisfying, I admit it. I get the impression, reading around, that this developer is considered a good one when it comes to HOGs. I wouldn't know, but on the strength of this it's well-deserved. The game's quite long; it took me a little over 6 hours to complete the game (including the two bonus chapters as this is the CE) which is about twice as long as some HOG games. Like most of these games, the difficulty level was towards the easier end of the spectrum, but frankly that works just fine inbetween bouts of Spelunky and Jets 'n' Guns. It's relaxing, and strangely compelling. Interestingly, each hidden object scene also offers a mahjong game. You can either do one or the other, and the more of the HOG you complete, the easier the mahjong game becomes (and vice versa). It's a good way of trying a different approach if you're stuck trying to find a particular object. That didn't happen very often with me, but I appreciated the option. There's no time limit on completing each scene, but if you do them quickly you can gather a few Steam achievements. The achievements were a little bugged though, not all of them registered, if that kind of thing is important to you. Puzzles? Yes, plenty of those, most of them very easy, but they're a nice change of pace. The game surrounding the hidden object scenes plays out like a point and click adventure, with an inventory and objects that must be found and used in the appropriate places, so there's plenty of variety to keep you going. There's even a map!

So overall then, the best HOG-like I've ever played (out of the three I've played over the last month). GOTY in the HOG category so far, in fact! But seriously, if you like this kind of thing you can't really go wrong. The artwork is excellent, the music and presentation are great, the storyline and acting are like fingernails on a blackboard, you'll love it.

Ok, so this is the first game for me on Steam. That being said, this isn't my first computor game. I am a huge fan of Hidden Object games, and this one is actually pretty solid. As far as I can tell you have your main storyline, which isn't anything that's going to blow you away, but it fills it's purpose. It's not a straight up "find these objects, then move to the next room" type of game, there is a lot to do here, and the great thing about it is you have a very useful hint button for when you get stuck...trust me you will. I just started last night and I've had to use it quite a few times. I'll finish the full review when I complete the game but you can't beat the price, so I'd give it a shot. If you love Mahjong and Hidden Object games, along with a decent story, this is your game.

Ok, So I'm not gonna lie, I got bored with this game pretty fast. But in all fairness, Borderlands 2 went on sale 3 days after I bought it...so that's a technicality.

It's a good game if you like "these" types of games.

Here's my statistical review, the numbers are based on a scale of 1-100 (70 is average)
Similar to Metacritic I geuss

Pros
-Graphics are very well put together, might be the best part of the game.
-A variety of differing puzzles and tasks to keep you entertained for a little while, its fun at first, for me at least.
-Very simple, my 2 year old could probably figure this out with some practice.
-The story is decent, predictable, but fits with whats going on around you while your doing various tasks.

Cons
-They make it way to easy to cheat, you can literally press the hint button throughout the entire game, you don't have to solve anything.
-The voice acting is cringe inducing and just...god awful. I didn't expect much from this kind of game but come on.
-The puzzles vary, but they get repetitive to a point where playing the puzzles just becomes a chore.

Gameplay-66/100
Graphics-82/100
Audio-44/100
Concept/Story-69
Features-60
Entertainment Value-53/100

Overall Game Score-62/100 (Below Average, it serves it's purpose and provides you with some puzzles to solve whenever your bored)

Buy it when it goes on sale again. This isn't for the casual gamer, you won't like it if these type of games aren't your cup of tea.

........

Hope you guys liked this review, I plan on reviewing every game I play on here, so all your feedback helps. Thanks.

9016009.review:
Short game, trite story, beautiful art, nice theme song.

  This is the first hidden object adventure game I have ever played, but I am a veteran of the old 90's style point and click adventures.

  For the most part you wander around, seemingly at random, until you find a "swirly" spot to click on.  This will start a hidden object scene search, upon completion you will be awarded an item, although some items are found without hidden object searches as well (general environment finds).

  Some of these items are used in puzzles, some of them are keys, and the rest are your traditional use on environment items that adventure fans are familiar with.  None of the puzzles are challenging, and all are logical.  The only exception to this rule is the "Urns" puzzle - the final one in the game.  Thankfully you can hit a button and skip any puzzle if you want, but this version of the game also has a strategy guide which you can access from the menu (probably not during a game though, but I never tested this).

  This version of the game does come with some digital "extras", most notably 8 beautiful (up to 1080p) wallpapers which are taken from the memorable scenes in the game.  In fact you can see three of these in the screenshots on the Steam Store page.  Naturally you get to play back any video you have already seen, and there is also some concept art (but not much, six images to be precise).

  Oh, there's also a mahjong game if you want to play that instead of finding hidden objects, but I never tried that feature.

  For the price I feel like the game is too short, versus something like Monkey Island II - another zombie themed pirate adventure, and probably the best adventure game of all time.  However, it's worth playing if you like pirates and the sounds of thunder and lightning and want to have the beautiful wallpaper art on your desktop (I do).

Uhhh... cięzko ocenić tą grę. Z jednej strony dawno chciałem pograć w point and click, z drugiej... gra jest za prostacka! Ale może to moja wina, że nie wziąłem trybu eksperta? I spodziewałem się chociaż minimalnych dawek horroru, a tu... nawet jakiegoś szczególnie mrocznego klimatu brak. Ot, coś jak Piraci z Karaibów: Klątwa Czarnej Perły bez elementów komediowych czy przygodowych (co może brzmieć dziwnie).

A teraz plusy. Na pewno sty graficzny - całkiem przyjemny. Wymagania - śmieszne. Historia - całkiem OK. Ale nie dziwie sie że dali ją za friko - chyba to i że dali karty to największa zaleta tej gry.

Mocne 6/10. Aczkolwiek spróbuję jeszcze trybu eksperta. Jak ktoś dostał za darmo - zagrajcie. Jak ktoś che kupić - czekać na -75%.

8996754.review: Un très bon point & click dans lequel on se prends volontier dans l'histoire intriguante et les nombreuses énigmes. Pour les amateurs du genre, vous ne serez pas déçus ;)

Wonderful and detailed artwork, albeit with fuzzy cutscenes and mediocre voice acting.

39475147.review:
Аляповатая смесь «Пиратов карибского моря», «Индианы Джонса»  и «игры в бирюльки», полная технических и логических артефактов, зато про пиратов! Guilty pleasure.

[h1]Сериал[/h1]
Нельзя обсуждать эту  игру без того, чтобы не сказать, что у неё есть продолжение в виде [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198084019881/recommended/284790/]Nightmares from the Deep 2: The Siren`s Call[/url] и [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198084019881/recommended/284810/]Nightmares from the Deep 3: Davy Jones[/url]. Это первая, можно сказать пилотная серия, которая страдает от нехватки денег и опыта. Но именно поэтому глупые и необъяснимые ошибки, сделанные при производстве, становятся всеми любимыми «фишками», бережно насаждаемыми в последующих инкарнациях. 

[h1]Поиск объектов aka hidden objects[/h1]
Новый для меня жанр компьютерных игр в исполнии поляков из Artifex Mundi, поэтому я весьма пристрастен. Это можно было бы назвать квестом или визуальной новеллой, если бы не абсолютная «рельсовость» сюжета и полное отсутствие выбора. Да, квесты тоже такими бывают, но  отнюдь не самые лучшие их образчики. Здесь же это основной  modus operandi. От «интерактивного кино» отличие заключается в том, что вас постоянно отвлекают на поиск объектов (или маджонг), ага. Следует отметить, что задники тут тщательно прорисованы, что несколько скрашивает беготню по локациям в поисках игровых артефактов. 

Для Nightmares from the Deep не нужно «внешнее прохождение», так как подсказки встроены прямо в игру: локации, где что-то можно сделать указываются прямо на карте, а стыренный у Джэка Воробья компас служит для более конкретных указаний и, что крайне важно, для возможности пропустить очередную загадку. Сама фишка серии в виде «поиска объектов» несколько напрягает, так как в кульминационный момент, где, скажем Лара Крофт сделала бы десяток трупов, приходится отвлекаться на минутку-другую для поиска этих самых объектов художественно раскиданных кучей по экрану, чтобы собрать сковородку (sic!). С другой стороны бирюльки тоже расслабляют. Игра то казуальная!

[h1]Проблемы первой серии[/h1]
Что и откуда утащили видно не вооружённым глазом — это не страшно в век постмодернизма. Неприятно то, что всё это искаженно и изложено так, что даже иск по «утаскиванию ИС» предъявлять стыдно. Видеовставки крайне низкого разрешения для FHD в отличии от прорисовке в самой игре. Озвучка не совпадает с лицевой анимацией. В общем в техническом плане это настоящий «первый блин».

[h1]Локализация[/h1]
Выбор языка (субтитры и интерфейс) в самой игре отсутствует, поэтому это следует сделать заранее в клиенте Steam: Правая кнопка мыши на названии игры→ Properties → вкладка LANGUAGE.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]
Ubuntu 16.04, ноутбук cо встроенной графической картой Intel® HD Graphics 4400. Имеется распространённая проблема с зависанием игры при переходе из полноэкранного режима по ALT+Tab или при всплывании внешних окон, включая сообщения о появившихся карточках. Если подавить всплывающие окна, то больше сложностей не возникает.

[h1]Обзор входит в список [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Игры, Linux, Steam, обзоры[/url].[/h1]

39545363.review:
(TLDR: This game is only worth the price if you buy it on sale, preferably at least 50% off.)

This definitely feels like an older Artifex Mundi game, like they hadn't quite figured out thier formula yet. The voice acting is slightly worse than I'm used to, the graphics are slightly worse than I'm used to, the story is slightly worse than I'm used to, etc. None of it is horrible and it was fun enough for an afternoon, but not fun enough to bother replaying for all the achievements and not fun enough to be purchased at full price. I bought this on sale and I still think I should have waited for a better sale. Still, you can do worse and the supernatural pirate theme is interesting enough that I'll probably check out the other game in the "Nightmares from the Deep" series at some point.
